i_type: Fall
details: While commuting to work I hit a patch of Black Ice on the Galloping Goose trail and went down injuring my right shoulder and bruising my upper thigh.  The morning was cold with heavy frost overnight so I had slowed down on my commute

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Crashed into side of car that pulled onto bike lane, ignoring the give way sign. Many cars do this; it could be better marked.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was cycling north on Westwood Street at night, wearing a reflective vest and with bike lights on. A truck was turning right from Davies Ave onto Westwood Street didn't see me until the last second (he had to break suddenly). Vehicles don't seem to look for cyclists.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Getting off the kent bike lane heading north onto cambie street.  Cars turning on or off cambie street onto/off kent. Have had many very close calls

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A truck was turning left onto Kings off Fifth Street where there is a barrier attempting to prevent cars from turning left making an illegal left turn. Cars still routinely turn left at this location despite the barrier. It is a dangerous spot for cyclists coming down the hill on Kings St.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: The driver of a parked car suddenly opened her car door when I was passing by. I kept enough distance from the car, but it happened so unexpectedly that I still swerved somewhat to the left. Fortunately no car was passing me at the time. It made me realize 1 m distance from parked cars is NOT enough

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: truck did not realize that there was a bike lane crossing the exit ramp

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: pickup truck passed with about 6" of clearance to me.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Forced into curb by car passing. There is no space for bicycles here due to very poor planning.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Collision with stationary object or vehicle
Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cyclist riding on the sidewalk struck me from behind as I was walking down the sidewalk. Cyclist stopped long enough to say sorry then road off.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A driver, as they frequently do here, cut across the bike lane instead of staying in his lane. I had to kick the side of his car to  make him aware of my presence. Happens all the time at this corner.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Was turning out of UVic parking lot and heading up Sinclar Hill Towards McKenzie when someone coming up the hill passed very close to me, I ended up bailing into the grass.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Riding west along Powell St in curb lane partly blocked by construction.  Car in outer lane queue swerved into curb lane at end of construction and touched me a glancing blow and almost knocked me off my bike - technically a hit and run.  The car, a dark coloured Ford Edge SUV did not stop.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle turned right across painted bike lane without checking mirrors, cut me off. I braked but still ended up colliding with their rear bumper.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was second of three bikes riding single file, all lighted front and rear. As lead entered intersection, an  overtaking car turned right immediately in front of lead. While avoiding collision, the rider slipped and fell.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was moving to the left side of the lane so that I could turn left into Britannia library entrance area.  A car came from behind and raced past me to try to get through the light at Napier or to "show me" I shouldn't be in his way.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Bike lane very poorly marked in a very dangerous situation.
Should be painted green or have crosswalk lights.
There is going to be a cyclist fatality here.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A van was approaching behind me and started to accelerate like I wasn't there. An oncoming vehicle was about to pass. Since the van looked like it wasn't going to stop, I moved into an empty parking spot.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Biking west along fort street and was stopped at the red light on the corner of Fort and Pandora. Cars turning right from fort onto pandora will often squeeze by me and today one hit my bike. No injury or damage and I waved the car to keep moving along.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was crossing cross walk on bike, a Lexus (99-2003) rolled into cross walk, driver not looking what's in front of him almost hit me while driver was going to turn right.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Cars were stopped for a red light, and I was biking towards the light in the bike lane. The passenger of a car opened his door into the bike lane to spit into the street. I didn't have space to stop, but yelled. He reacted to my yell and pulled his door closed enough that I was able to fit by.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Cycling downhill, road wet, breaks did not stop me fast enough and I hit the back of a queuing car and smashed their back window with my arm, and damaged their bumper with my bike. Cost me 180 in the end, take extra care in the wet with poor visibility due to trees

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Parked cars on both side of the street. I was in the narrow section when a speeding Car2Go entered from the wider part. I slowed and moved as far right as I could (near the parked cars). Her driver's-side mirror hit my handlebar - scary! The driver stopped further down the street, but then left.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle turning right did not yield

i_type: Fall
details: Conditions were otherwise okay, but black ice had collected at bottom of 7th ave before stop sign. Unavoidable fall. Should have been de-iced.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was biking EB on Drake in the middle of the travel lane as I was going fast (perhaps ~30km/h).  Driver pulled out of laneway NB in front of me, apparently without checking the street?  I fishtailed but luckily was able to stop within feet of the car.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: An SUV ran a stop sign at the 2 way stop at Manitoba & 14th, as I was riding through the intersection. We both had to slam on our brakes & came within a metre of each other.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver turned left off 12th Ave onto 2nd St. 2nd st. was backed up and the car stopped in the intersection. I had to stop quickly so as not to hit the car. Light was green, I had the right of way.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Was riding with my daughter when a bigger SUV drove us off the road and cut us off as we rode towards the round-about on Blenheim and 37th.  Not the first time this has happened on this street. Fast moving drivers often get frustrated by the  bicycle traffic on the narrow parts of 37th ave.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Motorcycle passed cyclist too close through intersection though cyclist was clearly in traffic.  The pass was so close it seemed like attempt to side swipe cyclist.  then yelled at cyclist to get off the road.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A car came near than 5cm while overtaking.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A parked car pulled out without looking, I had to swerve into opposite lane to avoid, luckily there were not cars approaching in the opposite direction.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was riding north along Range Road & a garbage truck pulled out from just north of Driving Force.  The driver did not appear to see me & continued pulling out into the road.  I yelled out to get his attention while turning sharply to avoid being hit. The truck stopped & I kept riding.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: 4 of us riding single file to the right of the white line.  A Gold Toyota Minivan license plate 258PJW  came along side of me and was 1-2 foot away from my elbow.  I felt i might hit me.  It continued to move within a foot of our lead rider.  It then crossed the white line in front of us.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Canucks night, Lots of Pedestrians
I was heading East on Dunsmuir in the bi-direction bike lanes.
A westbound car turned North at the intersection right in front of me. I had no time to stop  and plowed into the side of the car. Driver was likely concentrating on the pedestrians not the bike lane

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle making right hand turn on a red light didn't stop or look for bikes coming across green paint where I was biking with my kids, when we had the green light. I don't understand why right-turn on red is permitted here, the cars never stop or even look for bikes.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car turned left onto separated cycle track, so had to brake. Motioned car to stop. They realized where they were and backed up.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was cycling on the road because the path is unsuitable for cycling. The road had about 9 cars parked on-street over 300m, enough I didn't consider it safe to swerve in and out. An aggressive driver tailgated me honking his horn. When I turned right he undertook quickly and closely and abusively.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Traffic was stopped waiting for light. Car decided to to turn right from westbound outside lane on McKenzie across bike lane into PetroCan gas station.  I was cut off while traveling in the bike lane.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was travelling fast in a marked bike lane.  A taxi passed me and immediately pulled over into the bike lane right in front of me without signalling and I nearly collided with its side.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car passed me at speed, close enough that I had to stop. The road narrows and dips and has a bend, the driver was possibly driving faster and took a straight line, definitely accelerating in a 20 mph zone. I had moved nearer to the curb to let a car before me go past.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Lots of near misses in this intersection, particularly left hooks from those turning south to east.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Large truck was turning left onto Lee avenue. I was turning right onto leighton.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Car brushed my left-rear pannier with their right front fender as I pulled up to turn right.

I stopped to take a photo and saw more than one car pull into this bike lane while turning  right onto 6th. They were all swerving around left-turning cars waiting in the regular lane.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle pulled out from yield directly in front of me.  Almost slammed into the back passenger door of car.  Would have gone over the hood if I hadn't immediately hit the brakes

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Travelling westbound on Mckenzie and had just passed through the Mckenzie and Shelbourne intersection when a vehicle passed me and turned right in front of me into the esso gas station

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Truck was turning right onto Helmcken RD. Traffic was bumper to bumper and not moving and the driver was creeping into traffic without looking to his left. He hit the gas with no warning and nearly hit me. Then proceeded to flip the bird and yell at me through the his passengers window.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cyclist passing parked vehicles. Car approached from rear and forced past extremely close whilst cyclist negotiated speed bumps and another vehicle approaching from opposite direction. Cyclist forced to take evasive action.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Biker in front of me on lions gate bridge stopped abruptly and turned her bike towards underpass path thinking it was the bike lane. Underpass here is only for bikers and pedestrians to switch between northbound and southbound sidewalks.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I turned from the centre bike lane from Beatty to a bike lane on Smithe  with a green light. A car in the opposite direction almost hit me. It swerved to avoid me and I braked at the last moment. The unfamiliar move was a distraction which kept me from noticing the car.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Two cyclists traveling northbound on John turned right onto Cannon (bi-directional bike path). Reaching to ring bell to let them know I was about to pass heading east when they abruptly cut across my path  to "cross to the other side" was their reasoning afterward.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car started edging toward the rear of the bike my daughter and I was riding. They kept reving their engine and edging closer to move us off the road so that they could make a right.  The intersection itself is difficult enough to cross without the aggressive/angry drivers.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: This happens here all of the time: cars drive by too fast and too close. This time a SUV driver drove by me recklessly close.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car travelling S failed to stop at stop sign, shrugged an apology at me upon making eye contact as I swerved around them.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: BMW passed from my left side across two lanes to turn right onto westbound Lansdowne Rd without signalling.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A car turned right across the bike lane to enter the parking lot. I hit my brakes, skidded and hit the side of the car and was thrown from my bike.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Fall
details: Common collision area around this turn

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Distracted driver turned right in front of me

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle attempted to beat me to the intersection to make a right hand turn and pass me I one action by taking a wide right turn.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Have had multiple near misses here. Cars turn right and don't check bike lanes. Need physical barrier.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cut off by car pulling out from south side of adanac going W. Turns left with no signal and i follow behind. Car then turns right to continue into adanac without a signal as I took a sharp right to avoid being hit. Car swings immediately into a driveway right after his right turn nearly hitting me.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The bridge path is incredibly narrow, and very dangerous when passing

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: riding South in bike lane and a car traveling North on Hornsby (one way) turned into the bike lane to cross it and enter the parking garage.  I was traveling 20 km/hr and was only 5 m from the car when it stopped in my S bound lane.  I would likely have hit the car if it had not stopped.

i_type: Fall
details: Going downhill on Lac-Fortune Road, hit a frost heaved section / pothole in the road.  Lost control of bike and crashed at speed.  Road rash and bruises.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: vehicle turning south onto Foul Bay off side-street pulled out and turned right, immediately in front of me, as I was speeding down the hill. Had to veer severely into vehicle lane to avoid being hit.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was riding when a car (that was moving slowly due to traffic) suddenly turned in front of me to enter an alley.  I was able to avoid him (but did loose control of my bike), largely in part that I have disc brakes. The driver admitted he didn't see me, and was unaware he had to yield to bikes there

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: About 5 seconds after the light turned red, the driver (in the fast lane of the SJAM Pkwy) ran the red light. I had the green and if I had not double checked traffic as I passed the median and was about to cross the two East bound lanes I would have been hit. This car was going FAST!

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The intersection at Oak and 7th is awful. There's a blind hill to the south so it's hard to see cars coming. And on the north it's a very steep hill so many cars blast up the hill to keep up their momentum.  This needs to be a 4 way stop like at 10th and Yukon.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: 10 cyclists waiting to cross at a crosswalk. One car stopped for us but the truck behind sped up and passed the stopped car on the left & into oncoming traffic.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Minivan wanted to pickup someone waiting on the west curb of burrard. Driver swung into the bike lane nearly knocking me off my bike.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was biking east on the Cummings Bridge in the righthand lane with the sharrow. A person riding an e-bike westbound on the adjacent sidewalk caused several pedestrians and their dog to suddenly step off the sidewalk directly in front of me, forcing me into a dangerous swerve just to avoid them.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Almost hit (millimetres away) by handy dart but in school/cross walk zone as he passed me while going very fast

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I use Evans to avoid Heron/Bank. I was coming downhill toward Bank, fairly fast, and a car came out from behind parked cars which had been blocking it, making a wide right turn off Bank, I believe. I had to slam on the brakes.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: This intersection is pedestrian controlled. I hit the button and waited for the crosswalk signal to signal me to cross. I started to cross the crosswalk and a car ran the red light through the crosswalk when I was halfway through.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was the pedestrian that was hit, not the bicyclist.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details:
Road rage incident resulting with motorcyclist pushing me  on upper arm 4 feet over into the bike lane and less than 1 foot from the curb all at high speed because he thought I should be in the bike lane and not riding right next to it.  

An officer was lied to that I swerved into him.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Semi-trailer passed within inches. This is a divided road with two lanes in each direction.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Car Ran red light and made right turn around the corner with rear wheels tight to the curb.  I was tight to the curb entering the cycling path.  I had to choose between colliding with the curb or the car.  I chose to collide with the curb and was thrown sideways out of the way of the car.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: S. on Wharf intending to go straight through intersection at Belleville.  Nearing the intersection in the centre right of the straight thru lane, a SUV overtook me, then turned right, in front of me, to get into the right turn 'y' lane, turning R. on Belleville; wheels touched but I did not go down.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
When going west on 1st and crossing Quebec, the light turned green but a truck continued north on Quebec after it had a red light. It barely missed me and three other people who were cycling through the intersection.
This was at least two seconds after we had a green and the truck had a red.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: When bikes move from the shoulder of Admirals to the turn lane in order to turn left down Hallowell Rd during high traffic congestion, vehicles have pulled out from traffic and sped into the on coming lane to reach the left turn lane as well.  Its very unexpected and happens very fast.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Heading SW on Hornby bike lane about to cross Robson intersection.
Just before reaching intersection pedestrians started crossing the bike lane without looking for cyclists and totally oblivious to their red signal light. It was a close call.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
A cyclist was taken to hospital with unknown injuries after a crash with a truck. Police were called to the intersection of Idylwyld and 29th Street at 8:30 Wenesday, according to a news release. 
Police analysts are investigating the crash. No further details on the crash or the cyclist

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Oncoming car turned left through traffic, crossing bike lane to enter parking lot. Did not check for cyclists, turned directly in front of me. 
I yelled, older male driver did not even turn his head. When confronted, smiled, said he did not see me and walked off.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Crossing at marked cyclist crosswalk east of the Sperling overpass. Cars stopped for me (yay!) but cyclist blew right through the cyclist crosswalk on the right side of the stopped cars. If I had not anticipated him doing this, he would have run right into me at a high rate of speed.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A driver was pulling out of an alley and did not look my way.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car turning left off Cook onto View eastbound started turning as I was travelling through right lane. Forced to swerve to avoid.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A fire truck was rapidly bobbing and weaving around cars that were pulling over for it. I pulled over against a parked car and as the fire truck was maneuvering around a car in the other direction, it was headed directly toward me at a high speed before swerving at the last second.

i_type: Fall
details: It had just rained after being dry also green algae on road as being in a shaded area

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Our group rode through a road/bike path intersection, car approached the intersection at high rate of speed, after our group was already in the intersection, and the car nearly took out half the group.

Cars should most definitely have a stop-sign at that location.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Riding southbound on Cordova Bay Road, signalled left to go from bike lane to turning lane to turn left onto Ash Road just past the Mount Doug Park parking lot entrance.  A Saanich city van pulled out from the parking lot onto Cordova Bay Road, forcing me to slam on my brakes to not hit it.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
A vehicle approach from behind and proceeded to overtake me as I was preparing to make a left turn onto Pandora Street. I noticed and swerved away to avoid him from hitting me.

He failed to wait until I turned, instead moving straight ahead and overtaking me without regard for due care.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver did not stop at stop sign. Not the first time this has happened here as driver do not check both ways.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Stopped At bewicke waiting to continue onto 1st
At green light, cyclist ahead of me went straight, I was second, vehicle in intersection turning left towards me, looking right at me but continued to keep driving and didn't yield. Finally yelled and he stopped. He was completely zoned out. He rolled down his window, but clearly not with it early Monday morning. I had the green light, the sun was not in his eyes, I made eye contact and I was wearing bright pink. No reason for his negligence

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Left hook by small truck.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Driver parked and opened door without thoroughly looking.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Car stopped in the middle of the street (cars parked on both sides of the street) with little room between it and parked cars.  Rear driver-side passenger opened the door very suddenly with little time for me to react.  Had to swerve do avoid colliding with the door.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: This stretch of Craigflower from Tillicum to Admirals is the WORST for drivers pulling into the bike lane ON TOP OF YOU to turn right.  There is a curb that traps cyclists so you can't get out of the way.  Several times now I have had to scream to keep from being crushed.  Ride here with care!!!

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Crossing Conners Rd. at the marked trail crossing. Vehicle heading east travelling above the speed limit nearly hit me as I was crossing. Blind corner for vehicles and they are often speeding.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: a compact car passed me on a slight downhill grade and then preceded to back into a driveway.  by the time I realized their intensions it was too late to take avoid a collision.  The road is in poor condition in this stretch which may have been a contributing factor.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car tried to turn right into me as I was biking in the bike lane, straight through the intersection.  I slowed just before they started turning because I suspected that this would happen.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver coming north in alley and continued right into the road, without a full stop, as I approached.  I shouted.  She drove away, but she stopped and talked.  I pointed out that the stop should be at the sidewalk.  She stated that she can't see the road from there. Asked her to stop there first.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Van driver was going right in the middle of the street (it's a two-way street, with one lane per direction.) We were behind them. They slowed down extremely without using their indicators, and then turned right into a parking lot/back alley without checking over their shoulder.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Blue Jeep Safari (YKR 046) missed me by inches while passing me uphill.

i_type: Fall
details: It was slippery with leaves on the pathway and in making the hairpin turn down hill my tire spun out and I fell

i_type: Fall
details: My friend David fell on spur railway tracks in front of PJ Hardwood.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Narrow section of the road. Cars travel at high speeds along here to cut through this part of the city. Travel with caution.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was cycling on a traffic-calmed road (20mph limit but not enforced) when a car overtook with less than 1m distance. The car was also speeding, 30mph+ I would guess.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Was with my son, crossing St. Johns on a green light. Vehicle blew through red light doing ~60km/h nearly hitting us.  They appeared oblivious and did not stop or slow down.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car travelling eastbound did not see me cycling westbound and turned left into my path.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car approached intersection to make a left turn, but didn't look for bike traffic. I was nearing the intersection at the time. Driver gave no room for bike to cross. Had to slow rapidly and alter course.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Motor vehicle was nb turning right to go eb after passing me.  Right hook as I was proceeding nb.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car gave no space while trying to pass at high speed

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Riding with 8 year old to school. Heading onto Burrard Bridge and crossing Pacific w/ light.  Driver turned right from Burrard onto Pacific on a red light directly into us but stopped in time to avoid flattening us.  Not sure if signage not as clear for drivers with current construction?

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: SUV overtook me from behind and passed while I was in the traffic circle. Vehicle passed between the traffic circle curb and me. Somehow.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was riding downhill, straight on Braefoot, headed N towards Mckenzie.  White truck pulled up to T intersection in front of me, slowed down, then turned into my lane just when I was riding by -- missed me by a foot.   Driver apologized at McKenzie.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: After I started crossing Richards Street, the light turned yellow and a pedestrian started crossing the cycle track without looking. I braked hard and yelled and was able to stop before colliding. I yelled at the pedestrian to pay attention and continued on.

i_type: Fall
details: A small boy (approx seven years old), cycling with his father, fell at the railway tracks.  He was shaken, but mostly unhurt.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: 2-3' shoulder, the foliage was overgrown covering half the shoulder.  I had stopped and was standing on the gravel beside my bike away from the vehicle lane.  A truck swerved at me then at the last minute away, he continued to swerve along the highway. Unable to get licence plate #.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Used the pedestrian stoplight to crossover intersection. I was already halfway thru the intersection when I heard tire screeching, an SUV went thru the red stop light and almost hit me on the left side. A lot of witnesses in other cars saw the whole incident.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: with right of way, approaching front driver's side of vehicle, vehicle rolled thru stop sign while continuously looking to the direction opposite from where I was traveling and continued into roadway directly in my path to the point I had to slow dramatically and swerve to avoid being T-boned.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Pedestrian was being a #PokemonPylon in the middle of the trail.  There ais often a large group of people obstructing the trail in the evening, most move with the sound of a bell (need to use a LOT) but one individual did not move and there was not enough room made to travel on either side of him.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Warning: lots of  #PokemonPylon individuals at night in this location (30+).  Ensure you have bike lights and a good bell or horn if passing through.  Trail is often very congested so consider alternate route.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I stopped at 4-way stop. Could see cars coming down the road perpendicular to me but they were a ways away from the intersection still. I started to move forward and I hear the engine gearing up on the car arriving at the intersection. A cop car (another behind) was about to run the stop sign.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: This section of Bank St. has narrow lanes and a dooring zone. I took primary in left lane to stay out of dooring zone and prepare to turn left into Landsdowne. Driver behind me wanted me out of the way and used horn, tailgating and feigned lane changes to try to intimidate me. Was not intimidated.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Riding northbound on 8St SW, someone driving a vehicle heading EB on Royal Ave rolled out across the intersection and slowed down to a near-stop [less than walking speed], blocking the NB lane on 8 St. I braked hard, but managed to stay in control and avoid an impact, riding behind the vehicle.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Armoured truck passed me extremely closely (~30cm) just before the red light we both had to stop at on Quebec Street

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was riding riding in the only Eastbound lane on the road, about 1/3 of the way into the lane from the curb when a car aggressively passed me, only to immediately cut me off, braking abruptly and quickly, so he/she could then make a right turn to head south.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
I had 5 seconds still to go north straight through the intersection 
Silver car raced to make a left turn just as I was almost clear of the intersection. He slammed on his breaks enough to let me through. Many pedestrians standing on corner witnessed this. I was in the middle of the intersection, not going that fast and was very visible wearing bright pink 
Scared the crap out of me how close that was

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
An STO bus not checking his mirrors before pulling out from the stop where he was at a 45 degree angle almost hit me.
I screamed, he shrugged and sped off

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The CVG bike trail is combined with the pedestrian walk way near a bus stop

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Eastbound car was speeding. Intersection is very wide.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Fall

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: walking my bike across a crosswalk when a burgundy  BMW (license plate: API 76A) failed to signal or shoulder check while it was turning right.  Because of this failure to signal or shoulder check I was nearly hit.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was travelling straight through a junction with a green light on my side. A car pulled across me, I slammed on the brakes to avoid the vehicle and bike slid in the rain and hit the back of the car. Then fell onto the ground and slid along the ground. The car did not stop and drove on.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver coming from Peardonville to the east wanted to turn left onto Peardonville. Was going to run the stop sign when he finally noticed me and he skidded to a stop. It was still light out, I was wearing hi-vis.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Dump truck with trailer drove straight across Cook St, forcing me to brake and then dodge around.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A bus pulled out going into the bike lane just as I was beside it. The bus gave no warning and only signaled while it was moving into my side. I had to swerve into the traffic lane to avoid a collision.  If the bus signaled in advance I would have stopped and allowed it to move out of the way.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Minivan failed to yield right of way at stop sign. Side collision. Driver was very distraught and offered to pay for damages to bike, but no significant damage was sustained.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Large truck decided that stopping to enter a roundabout was unnecessary when a cyclist was approaching. I was moving > 25km/h, but he must have estimated my speed at < 10km/h. He attempted to enter before me, but I was already in the roundabout. Jumped in to the center median to avoid collision.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Was heading eastbound on 6th Ave NW in a painted bike lane approaching 14th St. NW in Calgary.  Car tried to turn right in front of me, through bike lane into alley. I hit his passenger-side door & mirror & fell off bike. Bruised knee but OK.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was traveling down hill towards a green light.  A car was speeding up to stop sign at a four way intersection before the green light. I hit my brakes but couldn't stop before the intersection. I yelled and put my hand out at the car. It hit me and I  woke up in the ambulance.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Trash bins are routinely placed in the bicycle lane on Beakes, causing the cyclist to either stop suddenly or swerve into traffic.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicles exiting HWY 1 via the right-turn slip lane onto Hastings (EB) are not looking to their right for peds/cyclists. These vehicles are approaching at high speed to arc onto Hastings Street  and the view is obstructed, making near-misses common place here. Enhanced safety measures are needed.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

details: A bus started to pull out in from of me from the street on the L. I swerved and veered to avoid

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

details: Watched dark blue commercial vehicle (tractor/trailer) approach from behind in my mirror, was not moving over at all. I had to swerve off the road onto the unpaved muddy shoulder to avoid being hit. Driver did not move over at all until after he was beside me and I was off the road.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
My son, Tommy Ketterhagen was killed by this incident. His death is a crime and the suspect is in custody and indicted on 3 2nd degree felonies. 
My responses in this report are as if I was my son so some don't make sense. 
Tommy was found on January 24rth by my wife. He had died during the night.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car turning to enter hospital parking lot did not yield right of way to myself (cyclist) who was in front of the car when it began turning right.

i_type: Fall
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Two lanes heading east on the overpass, no shoulder, just sidewalk on the right side. I was cycling near the curb, was passed by a white delivery van, came within a few inches of hitting me (had I stretched my arm out it would have been hit). There are two deep drainage grates on that overpass section near the curb (where bikes ride) that can easily throw you off your bike. If you swerve to avoid them you may end up in the path of overtaking traffic passing too close. Recommend taking more of the lane, discourage vehicles from passing you there, force them to change to the left lane or simply wait.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: There were eastbound vehicles lined so there was not enough room to pass. A motorist passed me nonetheless with much less than 1 meter cushion. I could have reached out and touched her car.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Passed on Old Jefferson Rd by a bright blue pickup. Driver allowed less than 2 ft clearance (easily within arm's reach) while passing and was angrily shouting out the truck window. He then cut me off with a sudden right hand turn and continued shouting until out of sight.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver went into the bike lane to avoid slowing down for a road bump.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cube truck that was in a line of stopped traffic started to reverse directly into me, I had jump off my bike and move into oncoming traffic to avoid being backed over. Presumably they decided last minute to parallel park.

I managed to go around.

As he turned into me, I was able to veer round, only bumped my pannier and rear fender.  But he did not stop!

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Blared horn then near miss doing 50 mph in a 35. Driver turned then came back from behind to harass me. Kept asking where I lived. Early 90's Mazda or Honda Civic with white paint, rust spots.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A truck over took me but then driver had to come back to the lane because there was a car coming in from the opposite line; the rear of the trailer almost hit me. i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was riding east on Wellington St. A vehicle on Hinton Ave N, heading north, proceeded to cross Wellington just as I was entering the intersection. They stopped when they saw me and I had to swerve. The sun could have been in their eyes.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Path makes an S-curve just before the canal and I did not see the bollard in the path. Swerved just in time to miss it.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Turning into the apartment building driveway, I caught my tire on the sharp edge of the curb, which is 1"-2" higher than the asphalt level due to road work. In low evening light, this misalignment is impossible to see. This problem exists all along Wyndham and York. Concussion and physio resulted.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Descending Foul Bay Road from Landsdowne and a vehicle pulled out from a side road to cross Foul Bay on the left into my path. I skidded and drifted so that I hit the vehicle on the rear passenger side quarter panel sideways, absorbing most of the impact on my left hip.

i_type: Fall
details: Wheel caught in trolley track as I was turning left over them. I fell to the left, injuring both wrists, leg, rib and nose. There were no warning signs about track danger from the place I entered Delmar to the place I turned.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was using the new 102 Ave bike lane and a car turned right from 109 onto 102 without stopping or yielding. I yelled through his open window; both he and his passenger studiously ignored me as he continued the turn.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Right turning mv on red light,driver only focusing on northbound vehicles on MMDr, not looking for southbound bicycle on regional path that had green light.

i_type: Fall
details: I was biking with my son (8 years old).  We were biking in the bike lane but vehicles are allowed to park in the bike lane on the weekends and he didn't feel comfortable riding in the road so  he road on the sidewalk.  Because the curb was not slanted he fell when transitioning from the bikelane.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: 2 cars stopped behind a left-hand turning vehicle. big blue van could not wait and veered into my bike lane to get around the Left-turning vehicle. must have been in a hurry as very nearly hit me though they knew I was there having just passed me not far before.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Eastbound Driver passed me extremely closely from behind, with only about 20-30cm space.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was riding straight through the two way stop intersection. A driver who was waiting at the south stop sign on  Manitoba turned left to go westbound on 18th before I got through the intersection. She saw me & made eye contact, then turned left suddenly very close to me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Bike lane on Laurier becomes trapped between traffic going straight and those turning right to get on the highway. Although there are barriers preventing the cars from getting into the turning lane too early, cars still cut through the bike lane or block bike lane entirely. Very dangerous

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver turning with no blinker, cut me off.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Braked to avoid car rolling through stop sign (car going straight, direction SE). 4 way intersection. Suffered concussion and broken arm. No memory of incident. Sightlines at intersection are obstructed by bushes.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Motorist turn SB from 102ave to 106st tight in front of me. I had to brake hard to avoid collision.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was headed southbound on the shared bridge sidewalk, and a southbound car made a left turn eastbound on the road in front of me. The new curb ramp location set back from the intersection meant that they thought I was turning eastbound as well, or perhaps they didn't see me at all.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Heading southbound coming off the new curb ramp from the bridge. Northbound car made a right turn in front of me not expecting me to go straight, since I was angled towards the east because of the curb ramp position.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was stopped at a red light beside the sidewalk and a vehicle pulled up behind me, squeezed by, not stopping, and turned right in front of me onto Island Park. It passed less than 2 inches from my left handgrip. So much for giving 1m space.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
A motorist approaching me from behind passed dangerously close by me, blaring his horn and swearing at me. I was travelling 38.6kph st the time (according to my speed sensor/Garmin). The speed limit on this section of road is 40kph. 

At the next stop in traffic, I knocked on the driver's passenger side window to chastise him for driving so dangerously, at which point he exited his vehicle and tried to chase me on foot. I feared his intent was to physically assault me, so I rode away. He returned to his vehicle and as he approached again, I recorded him on video, capturing his license plate (CPZ-632) and his using a mobile phone while driving.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Very close pass when completely free lane to the left for driver of large pickup truck.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle made an illegal right had turn at a red light, through two sets of crosswalks, cutting off several pedestrians and cyclists. This happens on a weekly basis.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicles accelerate very quickly from stop, around the "blind" corner and through the crosswalk while pedestrians have the right of way. Happens on a regular basis.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car wanted to turn left off of Vancouver on to Caledonia.  Car did not give bike right-of-way to go straight. Almost hit cyclist going straight on Vancouver.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I came around the corner at the NE multi-use path on the highlevel bridge, and another cyclist was passing a pedestrian on the corner and was on my side of the path.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was going straight through the intersection on the separated bike path.  I had the green light.   Car turned right without looking.  Near 'right-hook'.

details: Rear ended at stop sign

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver was on the phone making a left hand turn.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Motorcycle moved into the bike lane to go around a left turning car and almost hit me.  Happens to me here about once a month.  People in cars get impatient and drive their vehicle into the bike lane to get around left turning cars.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car was stopped at a stop sign heading west on Duke. He was looking in just one direction (towards one way car traffic) to determine when to advance.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was traveling south when a car blew a stop sign and hit the right side of me

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Riding south through the signal that turns into Costco/Fred Meyer the road turns slightly to the right.  Cars tend to drive straight when accelerating after a red light and often cut into the bike lane.  I have at least 5 near misses here per month.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was riding SB on right side of the road. Drivers in vehicles lined up behind a left-turning vehicle. Driver in white Honda pulled into my lane without checking blind spot, I hit front passenger side of vehicle. Almost got sideswiped by another vehicle in same lineup!

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver cut across the bike lane to turn without looking and cut me off. I had to brake hard to avoid being hit. (I have right of way)

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Incident occurred to a cyclist in front of me. A tour bus passed the cyclist on the left and cut directly in front of him, forcing him off the road and up onto the sidewalk.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver turning right failed to yield to cyclists going straight, hitting one

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Arrived ahead of vehicle. I did not push pedestrian cross light. Proceeded into intersection as I was ahead of vehicle, but slowed down to make sure. Car continued and driver reacted at last moment as she hadn't seen me. I angled away from car and continued on after car passed.

i_type: Fall
details: Crossing Adelaide to turn left on Duncan, wheel stuck in decommissioned street car track while shoulder checking for traffic and making lane change. Thankfully traffic behind me saw and stopped & assisted.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was turning left from bulman rd onto hereron rd and a car leaving the highway came speeding onto hereron rd almost hit me. I managed to serve out of the way

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Traveling southbound in 32nd street and went through a green light. Car to front and left of me turned right across the bike lane causing me to collide into it. My hand hit his mirror and broke it off and bike crashed into the side of vehicle and fell over

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A semi truck turned right on a red right turn light, and cut me off. I contacted the trucking company but should have called police.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was traveling straight in a through the dedicated bike lane heading east on 10th at Arbutus.  A car was in the force right turn lane.  As I rode through the intersection on a green light the car attempted to circumvent that force right turn and made a left around the barrier and hit me

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I heard that there was a cyclist struck on CBC radio and on 730 Traffic Twitter. Right lane is closed. Accident was southbound.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
SUV driver traveling South East along Borden Street  failed to stop at stop sign.
The incident occurred at the junction with Cedar Hill Cross Road where Borden Street crosses the two way separated bike lane.
The driver was aggressive and claimed he had the right of way.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Heading straight on Pacific St towards Burrard Bridge, riding in the right lane. Driver in lane to my left turned right in front of my and clipped my arm/bike with vehicle, potentially the mirror. Did not knock me off my bike and I was able to keep riding.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was riding at 20mph+ when a driver slowly passed me and then turned right in front of me.  I was able to stop in time, and the driver stopped, but claims not to have seen me.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The car was heading north on Juanita Dr, the same direction as I was. The car made a right turn into a business's parking lot, crossing into the bike lane without warning. I collided with the rear right corner of the vehicle.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driving east on Canora (from the airport), I stopped to let a road bike continue moving through the roundabout. I was on the inside or left lane. On my right in the 2nd lane a motorcycle came flying into the roundabout & came within inches of hitting the road bike who was exiting onto McTavish.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car turned right and through our family walking our bikes with a walk signal.  This is a bad intersection that needs rumble strips.  Even knowing cars might not stop you have to guess if the car is going straight or turning.   Either way they look left so making eye contact is nigh impossible.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A big truck, impatient and wanting to pass, revved his engines and honked. I was riding a metre away from the parked cars W on Bay St. The truck pulled out and around me and crossed the centre line. He shouted at me, not paying attention to the bus In opposite lane and broke both  side mirrors!

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Proceeding through intersection on a green light.  Other cyclists were ahead of me and oncoming in other lane.  Southbound car failed to stop at the red light. I swerved and accelerated out of the way missing being hit by cms.  Yelled to warn oncoming riders who stopped in time to avoid collision.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car heading South on Lakewood failed to stop at Stop sign and I only avoided collision by turning into Northbound (oncoming) lane of Lakeview.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The car ran the stop sign on Yew while I was in the intersection on 7th. I had to brake suddenly, causing me to fall off my bike.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
See article. https://www.nsnews.com/news/north-van-teen-in-hospital-after-being-struck-by-driver-1.23398274
Non life threatening injuries. Southbound cyclist struck by northbound driver turning left on to 16th from Mountain Hwy.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Guy in a white pickup truck turned into gas station without checking the bike lane. I slammed the brakes but still got my handle bar stuck in the truck's rear wheel. It dragged me a few metres.

Witnesses came to my aid and driver was still clueless that anything happened.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Express Trailers HGV backed onto kerb in front of old lady, banksman not paying attention

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car speeding to make light almost turned left into me at the intersection. Had to serve to avoid contact

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Suburban turned into us as we were crossing in crosswalk with a green light.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cyclist was going straight towards vic west and driver turned right, thru the bike lane without using mirrors and struck cyclist minor injuries and bike was fine

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was rear ended in the left lane shortly after merging to make a left turn.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Centerline bollards next to WSC on Luqa hill.  Bus cut in on me and I had to slow quickly to avoid it. This was quicly followed by Express Trailers container which was far worse that swerved in towards me. I had to jump off bike onto pavement.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car overtook to make left to enter Bay Quarter parking garage.  Had to break very hard to avoid left hook collision.  Matter of inches.

i_type: Fall
details: Several older adults were standing off the bike path, straddling their bikes looking towards Science World and False Creek. One lost balance and fell resulting in a domino effect.  A rider travelling in the opposite direction looked and swerved into oncoming bike traffic also causing a near-miss.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Bikes get green light at same time as cars. Biker in front of me did not check roadway, just went straight at high speed, regardless of car turning.  He would have hit side of car, therefore car there first. Bike should have yielded. Bikes should have different green light than cars at this crossing

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver rolled through stop sign southbound on Watson street & didn't look until they were in the middle of the intersection, blocking my path. I had to brake to avoid hitting them.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A transit bus ran the red light to make a left hand turn off Fort Street to Quadra.  I had a full green light and the driver seemed to not notice they were running through the red light. I had to stop at the intersection to avoid the bus before continuing through.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A mini-transit bus overtook me right at the intersection nearly missing me. The sign says bikes can take the lane, but vehicles rush right around you and sometimes very close. Suprised a city bus would be so aggressive.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Bike lane ends before bridge, forcing me to merge with traffic. A car decided to pass crossing the yellow line on the narrow bridge but then had to swerve back into to lane to avoid oncoming traffic(there is a blind corner) nearly squishing me between the curb.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car turning right off burrard into lane. Cut off cyclists in pretected bike lane.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Traveling east on the york bike street downhill to arbutus as we entered the intersection ( two way stop our right of way) a vehicle heading south also entered the intersection and stopped in front of us, we had no time to break and collided with their side.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A vehicle turned left in front of us from the oncoming lane after waiting a brief period seemingly waiting for us to pass before turning.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle stopped at a red light waiting to make a left turn. I started to cross in the cross walk. The driver looked left for oncoming traffic but didn't look back to the left before starting to move and hit me in the side of the rear wheel. The driver left the incident without stopping.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Headed east in the bike lane traveling fast through the intersection and partially obscured from oncoming traffic by an eastbound SUV in front of me. As I entered the intersection, an oncoming van turned left towards me. We both slammed on our brakes and the driver yelled and gave me the double bird

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Heading south on Hardy and Southern, a car was leaving the gas station from the hardy side, while I was on the bike lane on hardy, the car was leaving the gas station without clearing right

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: 2nd right after incident, at the traffic light of Hardy and Southern, heading straight to the south, while I'm passing the traffic light, which is green at my traffic side, a minivan is turning left coming from the west on southern south to Hardy, the women in  van didn't bother to clear her left

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: I'm passing a long line of cars A car moves to the right as if it wanted to drive to the parking lot on the right while i'm alongside her. I  brake hard and continue.  100m later the car passes me and passenger makes fun of me for freaking out.  It appear they did it on purpose. BXMY 871

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Truck pulled out of a gas station and cut me off.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Riding the bike path next to the wedge of grass by this intersection, an eastbound vehicle proceeded straight (across yellow road lines) instead of following their designated lane through the curve to the south (towards Grant MacEwan). I swerved into vehicle traffic to avoid being hit by her.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Heading W on 91ave. Vehicle headed N on 150St slowed (they have a yield sign) then accelerated into the intersection, not yielding to me. I braked and avoided being hit from the side.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver turning left across bike lane/multi-use path was looking only at car traffic and failing to check MUP for other users. I was going straight across and we both had green lights. Driver saw me at last minute and slammed on the brakes missing me by inches.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car passed me and turned right in fron tof me. Had to stop suddenly to avoid broadsidiing the car

i_type: Fall
details: Front wheel slipped on dangerous slick surface because of inappropriate material used fo surface.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
On the south side of Patterson station there is a cycle track through the bus area, and pedestrians often walk along the separated and signed cycle track to short-cut to their bus. 
This happened again today - I rang my bell and asked them please not to walk in the designated bike area.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Beinahe wurde mein 7 Jahre alter Sohn bei der Querung der B76 (Nutzung der grnen Fugnger-/Radfahrerampel) von einem vom Domstag kommenden und Richtung Kiel abbiegenden PKW erfasst. Dieser konnte gerade noch ausweichen.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Passenger opened car door to exit the vehicle as I was ~10 meters from them (coming quickly downhill), slammed on my brakes and hit the curb to avoid impact.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Punishment pass by vehicle with NYKL Contracting markings. Driver tailgated, then attempted to run me into a parked vehicle.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Fall
details: Vehicle accelerated ahead of me to make an immediate right turn while I was going straight. In doing so, cut me off.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cyclist using the crosswalk, at 37th and arbutus, to continue south along the greenway. A car turning right onto Arbutus from 37th was not paying attention and hit the cyclist.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A great new bike lane was installed with the bridge upgrade on Wilkinson, unfortunately it ends at the top of a hill right in a curve. I stayed on the road as the bike lane ended and a truck passed me within inches. I now ride on the sidewalk after the bike lane ends or generally avoid the area.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: GMC Yukon ran a red light (where NYPD was directing traffic) as I was crossing with the green light. The bike lane intersects the road and my view of the intersection was obstructed by the train track support beams. The SUV driver swerved and I hit the brakes and he missed me by inches.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: On Hwy 70 traveling in the correct lane, as the shoulder was full of debris/gravel unable to ride safely,  a semi-truck was passing another semi-truck in the opposite lane, came head on at me with no reguard for me being in the lane. I had to swerve off the Hwy to avoid certain death.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was heading SE on Dunsmuir on my usual route home when a car made a right turn coming NW on Dunsmuir on to NE Homer. I'm a seasoned cyclist and very agile, but did not have time to react to this person who did not yield. I ended up sliding across the hood and landing on the street.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Passenger on bus with headphones on sprinted out the doors without looking both ways. Near miss with other cyclists including myself. This is a recurring problem on this stretch with pedestrians and headphones.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Car parked on the side of the road opened their door (probably without looking) right in front of my bike. I swerved just in time.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: car was determined to pass me, even though there was no space. Was almost sideswiped by their mirrors.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A car looking to cross Ontario has a 2-way stop sign. He lets the cyclists pass, then pulls out slightly and stops when I make eye contact, I slow down slightly but continue as I have no stop sign. He pulls out further and stops halfway in middle of intersection. I can't stop and hit side door.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Following a garbage truck that turned into a laneway - only to have the garbage truck immediately start backing up!! Was going downhill and was too close to garbage truck to stop!! Swerved and sped up, and just missed the garbage truck by mere inches. 

Note that the date and time may be incorrect

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle drove through stop sign on Prospect Lake Road Crossing West Saanich towards Sparton Road directly in front of my while I was riding on West Saanich Road

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: This is just the latest of 20+ near-misses at this intersection.  People coming off the freeway approach this intersection at high-speed, ignoring the stop lines, and wanting to run the stop sign altogether.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: turning left from the Wilson Park bike trail onto Estes Drive. A driver of a Honda civic (couldn't see the license plate, plus the driver sped away from the scene) facing me and coming from Estes Park Apartments complex was turning right onto Estes Dr. He hit my right pedal with his bumper.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A silver car, licence plate 908KME, failed to shoulder check while turning right on a green light. Very nearly missed me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: BMW heading NE on Hornby made illegal right across separated bike lane without stopping to look

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: 3 cyclists in line. 1st cyclist moved out to avoid a garbage can but 2nd cyclist clipped the can crashing and breaking my femur. Also a concussion despite wearing a helmet. 3rd cyclist managed to avoid hitting fallen cyclist.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details:

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I witnessed this incident.  A cyclist was turning left from the crosswalk onto the painted bike lane.  The rider cut close to the left-hand turn lane. A car with an elderly driver in the left hand turn lane came in fast, stopping at the last possible moment slightly past the stop line.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Deer ran across the road west to east and passed less than a meter in front of me

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: As i was riding North on Fraser Street a driver turned out of a laneway on the east side of the street to go North. He didnt see me at all & i couldnt swerve enough or stop in time, so i hit the back end of his car & then fell into the street.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Motorist leaving gas station failed to yield. She was looking to her right as she was entering the street, missing traffic coming from her left.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Pick up truck passing a slower vehicle, on a two lane Hwy 70 in my lane with plenty of time to wait until I was safely out of my lane, but did not and seemed to be intentional to force me off of the road with no consideration.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Hit a pedestrian who was trying to cross the street against the light - he looked for traffic in the opposite direction (one way street heading East) and didn't think to check for bicycles heading West. I alerted him of my approach but didn't have time to properly correct myself before striking him

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Truck Driver Failed to Stop at STOP sign.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Going 30KPH in the bike lane. a car pulled over to attend a yard sale. I collided with the back of the car. Broke my face in multiple places, broken finger, concussion and a hospital stay.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Approaching the Tolmie/Quadra intersect, cycling in right hand lane - 3-5 cars stationary in the left lane behind a vehicle waiting to take a left turn at the intersection. 10 m before the intersection, one of the cars in the left lane pulled into right lane right in front of me, near collision

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Parked car pulled out into right lane where I was riding without looking. Travel lane included a sharrow for bicycle traffic. I was forced to move left into the next lane. Thankfully no car next to me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Motorists coming off Highway 1 using the right slip lane to access Hastings street are not looking for cyclists & pedestrians coming from the path to their right (they are looking for Hastings traffic coming from their left). Major safety issue!

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with stationary object or vehicle

details: Someone create a crowdsource site for Prof to collect jokes

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle

Blue Ford Taurus: License CNBC 461

Someone is going to get hurt bad here!

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was cycling on Beach Drive near Cattle Point in Victoria BC and a deer leapt into the road immediately in front of me.  The deer and I had glancing contact but the deer did not unseat me.  Weather good, road quiet, mid day, visibility good.  The deer came out of nowhere.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cycling straight when a car came by the side too fast and hit with side mirror. Did not stop or slow, appeared to have not seen.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Punishment pass, Blue Toyota Corolla lic 195-JG3. Passed within 6 inches of my shoulder intentionally threatening me. I have proof video from front and rear cameras. i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: While heading E on Dry Creek Rd., I was struck by a car that had been heading North, but had stopped to make a left turn.  They turned directly in front of me as I was riding in my lane.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

A driver turning left off of Shelbourne and onto Feltham did not appear to see me (corner where I was waiting is poorly lit) and also entered intersection. We both braked and narrowly avoided colliding.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Truck turning right into parking garage proceeded through bike lane without looking or slowing.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A vehicle approached from behind and began honking when they were still nearly a city block behind me. As they approached they accelerated toward me and passed within 1 foot at 40mph. They then skidded to a stop, backed up past me, and accelerated toward me a second time.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle nearly turning right from Westfield to Kessler nearly hit me while I had the right of the way in the crosswalk. Vehicle had to stop abruptly approximately 4' from me to avoid collision.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Fall

I am not sure what time this incident happened but possibly visibility was low and it may have been dark. Curb to path splits middle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was heading straight through the intersection. He was turning left and hit the back end of my bike.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A truck crossing from east to west on 2nd, across Victoria stopped just short of hitting me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
This part of Puget Drive is very dangerous for cyclists. Many speeding cars going in both uphill (south) and downhill (north) early in the morning and late in the afternoon; sometimes in both directions simultaneously.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I signaled for a left turn about a block ahead of time.  Checked my mirror and saw a van about a block behind me. As I started turn, van sped up and started to pass me. i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A vehicle attempted pass me as we were approaching a 4 way stop.  There was not enough distance for the vehicle to complete the pass before we got to the intersection.  Rather than stop beside me, the vehicle abruptly swerved to the right forcing me out of the travel lane.

details: Westbound driver passed me & my children extremely closely as we were riding through the intersection of Oak & 14th.

i_type: Fall

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was travelling in a SE direction on Talbot and saw a vehicle on Victoria approach and stop at the stop sign.  I continued into the intersection since I had no stop sign and the vehicle had stopped.  Apparently the driver did not see me approach and proceeded with a left turn and struck me. i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The bike lane paint is nearly all gone and the bike lane is not guarded or separate. A Red Mazda SUV went in the bike lane twice within 2 minutes. I had to break both times to avoid collision.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Twatwaffel pulling out of clover point against the no left turn sign tuned left onto Dallas road without even so much as a glance. Had to lock up brakes to avoid a collision. the driver gave me the stink eye when a shouted WTF at her. 
Its ok to punch shitty drivers, they need to learn to fear cyclists because cops in Victoria don't care about our safety.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver didnt clear the intersection and was stopped on the green cycle cross walk. My daughter and I were crossing with the cycle crossing lights but the driver had no idea we were there and started creeping forward just as my daughter was riding in front of her car. I yelled at my daughter to stop and thankfully she did. The driver showed no reaction- had no clue. Normally my kid rides with her friends but I just happened to go along for a ride that morning.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
A pickup truck passed my while I was in the diamond lane (reserved for buses and bikes). The driver had been in the lane to my left, but swerved into my lane and made contact  his side mirror hit my arm. I lost balance but recovered without falling. The driver yelled out his window, something like, "I should ram you into that f___ing wall." 

I took note of the licence plate and model of vehicle, then reported the incident to the Winnipeg Police as a hit-and-run.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
