details: Car nearly hit me as it was turning right at the intersection and I was proceeding straight. Right hook.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cars parked on street and pedestrian came past parked car and collision almost occurred

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Crossing the street in crosswalk on green light.  Driver turning right collides with the rear wheel of the bike

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Woman struck by car when it abruptly turned into city hall underground parking. She was in the bike lane going east and had to turn sharply to avoid a serious accident. Bike and car bushed and rider said the car ran over her foot. She was shaken up but not seriously hurt.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Passed extremely closely (15cm?) by the same Maserati, twice in three blocks

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Collision with stationary object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicles from two Eastbound lanes and one Westbound lane try to turn South on Lyon St., and cross the path of cyclists going Eastbound on Wellington.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver almost hit me while turning right, then yelled at me for being in the lane to begin with.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cycling north in bicycle lane on Woodroffe Ave in block between Hunt Club Rd W and Majestic Dr.  NO traffic on Woodroffe when I entered from recreational pathway at Hunt Club. Was right-hooked by a late model grey Ford F150 turning to enter the medical office bldg parking lot, just before Majestic

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cars often (I see it every day at least on morning commute and often on evening commute) run the red light at Atwood and Dunning, so crossing the street requires looking both directions more than once to be certain cars are stopping.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: the woman was hit from behind by a passenger car around 4:30 p.m.  Its unclear at this point whether shell survive her injuries or not, Underwood said Monday. http://www.dailyinterlake.com/news/local_montana/bicyclist-pedestrian-hit-by-vehicles-on-u-s/article_cff19898-7eb0-11e6-b745-b31e1d12ec3d

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Fall
details:
The trail looked like it had a slight bend and had no indication of being anything other than straight or a slight bend, but in fact it was a hard turn that was hidden behind very high grass/straws,
Saw the turn way too late and had to choose between hitting a car-blocking-fence or going of trail.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver did not observe traffic signs

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Crossing Jackson south-bound on the greenway, a red lifted pick-up truck accelerated and swerved towards us at the crossing. Passenger also yelled profanities and threw something (trash?) out the right window.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Crossing the exit/entry to Tuscany Village when a SUV turned left in front of me to enter the shopping center. Had to brake hard to stop or else would have been hit.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A pick-up truck travelling east on 18th Ave. only paused at the stop sign and turned left, NB, onto Slocan, failing to yield to me. I emergency braked to avoid a collision and nearly hit the right side of his truck.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Riding in the center of the right lane.  Speed limit is 35 mph, but cars were traveling 45-60mph.   Overgrown trees and grass block line of sight around curve.  Assuming SUV did not see me as soon as would be safe.  SUV straddled lanes, passing inches from L handlebar, while honking horn.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car making left turn across traffic didn't look ahead to see i was in the intersection. I stopped to wait for car. i just witnessed a pedestrian hit by car, 2 minutes earlier in same situation.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Trying to pass a slower cyclist on the left before entering the separated bike lane. The other cyclist veered to the left.  I tried to avoid the collision by moving to the left but there wasn't enough distance to stop or make it to the street. I hit the start of the cement lane separator.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: There was a black squirrel chasing a grey squirrel. The grey squirrel darted near in front of me. I turned hard but felt an unfortunate soft bump and heard a sickening squeak as my front tire ran over the black squirrel. He climbed a tree and appeared unhurt but alarmed. Sorry squirrel buddy.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I had signalled my intention to turn and moved slightly more centre in the lane for the 90 degree turn, started to brake, stood up on my pedals to be more visible and a large truck, at high speed, came along side close enough to touch and pulled in front of me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car cut too close despite there being two whole lanes in the direction I was headed

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: going down to east on Dunsmuir bike lane  in fairly fast speed and tried to  make the green light at Main St intersection. A cyclist ahead of me suddenly turn left before I was entering the intersection and cut me off.  Braked to avoid him and slightly crashed and fell down.  A ambulance was called.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I entered the round-about between two cars, one ahead of me and one behind me. In the round-about, which is quite narrow, the car behind tried to overtake me eventually forcing me to exit the round-about one exit early.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was heading straight through an intersection on a freshly turned  green light (Ie, I had right of way). Several vehicles entered the intersection after the left hand turn signal had ended; the last one came close to hitting me. I use this intersection often and frequently see cars 'run the light'

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Crossing knight st on the green and  pedestrian lights, riding my bike slowly, making sure every car stop.  A pick up truck turning southbound from 37th street hit my rear bag, broke it (it felt in the middle of the street) and my bag rack got twisted.  The driver didn't stop.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car driver claimed not to have seen me, the cyclist, riding on a bike lane. The car decided to abruptly turn right.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Moving vehicles do not give you the right of way when crossing the street and often turn onto Innes Rd. while you are crossing on your bike, seemingly on purpose. I have been nearly t-boned twice this past week.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Southbound on Shell.  The car ahead of me indicated that it was going to turn right onto Westminster.   I moved to the left to pass him.   The car behind me attempted to go left around me and then turn right in front of me to west.  Dangerous!  He honked his horn loudly at me.  I had right of way.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: If you come to the intersection late (with walk sign still on though) cars sometimes aren't looking for additional pedestrians/bicyclists

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver attempted to pass on the right when both were exiting the roundabout.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Entered the Science World parking lot from National Avenue, into what could be called a "T-intersection" within the parking lot,  about to turn south into the parking area when a bicycle heading north passed through without stopping, disregarding the painted "STOP" with stop line on the pavement.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Close pass by a distracted driver. I caught up to the driver at Fallowfield/Prince of Wales intersection and witnessed this driver staring into the phone/device on their lap.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: There is a bus stop about 100 metres after the light, so busses speed to try and beat the cyclist to the bus stop (there is a bike lane).   This driver was not speeding fast enough, so cut me off an nearly hit me.  This is my FOURTH near miss with an OCtranspo driver - TRAIN THEM BETTER! OCTRANSPO!!

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Semi was exiting the 101 onto Price Rd w/o slowing to the 45 mph speed limit. Speeding inches away from me on my left.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver was tailing another vehicle that was making a left turn and failed to stop at the entry of the intersection to check for cyclists. Both driver and myself braked. My front tire went into their front bumper by the passenger side tire and i fell onto their hood, got small bruise. Car left scene.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Bus driver cut off cyclist, and said well you were on the road. There's no bike lane there

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Motorist drove passed me too close hitting my ass with there passenger mirror.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A driver for a courier company (there was a Vancity Couriers sign on the door) cut me off and brake checked me.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was heading east down 16th, car was crossing 16th from N to S. They did not yield as I passed through the intersection and thought that they could beat me through it, which they technically did as I T-boned it and took the rear window of the SUV direct to the face. Was off work for ~5 months.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: vehicle swerved into bike lane to avoid going over a large construction metal plate

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was signalling Left and about to move over in order to turn left at the intersection of 10th and Main and the car behind me tried to overtake me before the intersection.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Large truck after doing roundabout came west in what could only fit 1 way traffic, and straight down middle where I already was. Left no room I had to stop and press against parked car. It was like they didn't see me but my bike is like a Christmas tree so that simply isn't possible

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cyclist got left hooked from the front and killed, cyclist had a green light, sight line are bad, the intersection should be a stop sign not a light, the intersection doesn't warrant a signal.  http://www.krcrtv.com/news/local/shasta/bicyclist-killed-in-crash-identified/11123451

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Was riding in bike lane.  Parallel car rode up to line and stopped at green light with right turn signal illuminated.   Appeared that car stopped for cyclists to proceed.  Proceeded through intersection.  Car moved to right and blocked my path .  I ended up on the ground falling to the left.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Ca r car door was flung open to its full as i arrived at the car.   It was pouring rain and i had a line of cars on my left and a line of parked cars on my right.  I narrowly managed to dodge the suddenly opening door.    I had very little space to manoeuvre due to the traffic.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Pick up truck came up behind me while I was in bike lane. Clearly was going to drive right through me. I took evasive action to the right resulting in a fall with injuries.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Traffic turning right hooks the bike lane, have almost gotten hit multiple times by patient drivers bike lanes on the wrong side

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: I was shoulder checking, to merge, where the bike lane ends, when I hit the edge of a large steel plate (covering utility work).  Luckily I fell from a recumbent bicycle (low) onto the slippery steel and only suffered minor bruising, but no road rash.

i_type: Fall
details: There was a car illegally parked on the eastbound side of the street. Any bike hoping to move that way would have to cross over into the streetcar tracks and then back. As I  attempted to make it over the streetcar tracks and back onto the right side of the road, my tire locked into the tracks.

i_type: Fall
details: A couple of bikers (one young male and one young female) riding on Stanley Park Seawall bike path but they occupy the whole width by one riding to the left and the other to the right. When this rider approached they still remained, one on the left and the other on the right. This rider fell between.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Because of glare from other headlamps, I slowed down. A second cyclist, possibly also blinded by an oncoming headlamp, ran into my bike from behind and fell. He said he was okay, got back on his bike and rode off.  A fender strut was bent, otherwise no damage.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I stopped at four way stop when westbound on 1st at Wylie, started to make my left turn, waiting for car to cross intersection, as I was about to proceed, 2nd car when through stop sign without stopping. I hit the brakes to avoid him running into me.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Taxi cab was turning left in front of me and focused on the fare and not me.  Had to stop suddenly and veered to the right.  Brakes caught and I went flying over the handle bars.  

Scrapped my right knee something gnarly.   Cleaned up and coasted the 2 km home.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: There is typically just enough room for one cyclist between the parked cars and the traffic lane. Traffic was heavy and the parking lane was full when another cyclist passed me (illegally). Our handlebars passed within 6" of each other. If we'd touched, a serious crash was probable. STUPID!

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Riding east through Hemlock on 10th a vehicle very nearly turned left into me in the intersection. I was already 2/3 of the way through & he only stopped when he was less than a metre from me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A westbound driver blew through the stop sign, nearly hitting me as I was already into the intersection. He looked at me as he sailed past & appeared not to brake at all.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Biked north on foul bay street and the car with the yield sign from fort caddy bay road did not look and just came right for me. I yelled and stopped in the middle of the road falling off my bike and injuring myself. The car (a silver subaru forester with an older man driving) kept going. Not happy.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car pulled out of t junction turning left too close to when I would pass. Had to break to avoid hitting side of car.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Car pulled out at t junction then stops while straddling bike lane. Managed to stop in time.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car turned right at roundabout without indicating while I was alongside. Had to brake to avoid collision.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car pulls out at give way junction from Aldi to main road direction but parallel with road. I.E. drives on bike lane and pavement. Drives slowly and unpredictably.  Had to slow to avoid collision.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car drifts into bike lane. Squeezed.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle heading same direction as me passed me while vehicles also parked on both sides of the street. I was out approx. 1 m from cars parked on my right. Vehicle passed me on my left with maybe 50 cm between my bike and his side-view mirror. Vehicle hardly slowed speed at all.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Yet another car pulling out in front of me at a junction to turn left

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cyclists/walkers trying to cross Broadway are at great risk because cars coming over the Broadway Bridge hill at high speeds don't see the vulnerable roadway users until they are upon them. More is needed to alert and slow traffic, e.g. crosswalk pylons placed in road, "This is Your Speed" signs?

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Road slants slightly at this location, and there are frequent RVs and commercial vans parked there. Speed limit 25, car passed closely (< 3 ft) going at least 35+mph. Cars headed south frequently cross the line at slant; northbnd cars would then swerve into cyclists on sharrows.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The truck didn't stop at the Stop sign at the intersection. Breaking and turning my bike sidewise, I managed to avoid getting under the truck's rare wheel.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Multi use pathway forces crossing at a ped crosswalk across alta vista.  Rode across with ped signal, woman driving sedan making a right turn on a red drove towards me.  I avoided a frontal collision by swerving, but impacted the right side of the vehicle and fell to the ground.  Front fork damaged.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I en rundkrsel ved Ringboulevarden og Hobrovej holder en bil stille, s den 14-rige tror, at bilen holder tilbage for ham. Det gr bilisten ikke. Bilen krer frem, og drengen bliver pkrt. Den 14-rige dreng har flkket en hndrodsrodsknogle og fik hudafskrabninger i ansigtet.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Brush-by from white pick-up truck. More details and photos here: https://twitter.com/itsakev/status/794275112761454592

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: White van did not shoulder check to change lanes. Almost hit bike. Video and more details here: https://twitter.com/itsakev/status/783347804437483520

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Brush-by from van with AB licence plate 12L212. More details and video here: https://twitter.com/itsakev/status/718098215996776448

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: group of female cyclists travelling in line, passed by a white escalade, escalade returned to lane early to avoid oncoming cyclists, force a crash between two bikes, one went over the bars

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Crossing the crosswalk on Main on my bike, got T-Boned by a man in his Honda Civic, running the red light going southbound.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver pulled into bike lane suddenly and continued to remain in the bike lane before turning right onto Cedar Hill Rd, apparently thinking the painted bike lane was a second (narrow) car lane.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Deliberate intimidating close pass from a truck coming behind a cyclist in the left lane. Truck driving was yelling abuse at the cyclist and passed at 60km/h+  with centimetres to spare.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Using the crosswalk on Interurban to leave colquitz creek trail and join the goose. Car ran the crossing light and just missed me. 

I have had several close calls at this crosswalk especially during around noon and 4 to 6.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: biking along Feltham heading towards Shelbourne when a car leaving Lambrick Way pulled a rolling stop and nearly drove into me.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: car trying to get onto Foul Bay from Taylor pulled out in front of me. I managed to get stopped just before impact. Female driver smiled and waved, then backed up to allow me to continue.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: As I crossed a level road crossing, a commercial van did not stop at stop sign. I yelled and swerved and narrowly missed having my rear wheel hit. If I had entered intersection a moment later I would have been hit.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The westbound bike lane on Esquimalt ends as it approaches Tyee. There is a right turning lane. I was trying to cycle straight, and therefore signaled that I was moving lanes to do so. Motorist coming up behind (very fast) and turning right onto Tyee ignored the sharrows and passed unsafely.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car tried to pass me in single lane. Was unable to get by in time and swerved and almost hit me

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Travelling north-east on Clarke Rd with two other cyclists riding single file behind me. Stopped with traffic at an intersection, proceeding to ride single file and with traffic when the light was green. Large white Ford SUV behind comes to close to riders behind me before veering closer to myself,

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The driver of a paratranspo bus chose to pass too closely. The bus had a large side mirror that nearly hit me in the head. The driver should have waited until there was no oncoming traffic to pass.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details:
I was doored by someone getting out of a parked car. 

I was cycling on Commercial Drive because I wanted to do my shopping. I was visiting various shops along the street.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cycling southbound on Gordon, motorist cut me off turning right from Surrey onto Gordon, then collided with my rear wheel while turning right into McDonalds.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Yielding at the stop sign to cross Queens.  Car from east approaching above the limit speed.  Misjudged speed of this car.  Made it across, but felt shaken.  Hazardous for pedestrians, too.  Car often do not stop for people in the marked cross walk and swerve around them.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
I witnessed this incident.

At the top of the Heather St. hill, I heard yelling behind me. I stopped and looked back. A man rode down the hill towards me, I asked if he was OK, and he complained that a car stopped suddenly in front of him. Then he tore off down the hill.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The driver was edging out of the stop sign and only saw me at the last minute. I had to brake pre-emitively just in case the driver had not seen me

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The driver was at a stop sign and had indicators to turn right (east). I was heading west and could see the car ahead of me when all of a sudden the driver decided to turn left (west) and nearly side swiped me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver failed to yield to me at intersection. He rolled (southbound) through a stop sign right in front of me, I had to hit my brakes. It's a two way stop but drivers often blow through it, totally ignoring bike traffic on 14th.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: lump 3 inchs high in pavement , watch for it or high speed crash will happen

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was southbound, along the right side of the road. A motorist travelling eastward on Old St. Patrick failed to stop at the stop sign and began to accelerate towards me on the wide turn. He slammed on the brakes at the last second after noticing my presence and stopped within a meter of hitting me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: After having to follow me at bike-speed for 1.5 blocks, an aggressive driver intentionally swerved at me when I finally had space to move over for them.  This was preceded by this vehicle dangerously accelerating at me from behind a couple of times as attempts to intimidate me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver didn't feel like waiting for the car that was turning left in front of him so he jerked out into the bike/right turn lane to go around. Nearly piled into him.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Southbound driver on Manitoba rolled through the stop sign & nearly hit me as I was riding east through the intersection.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Heading south on Barnard, where it bends left to become Granville, there is a median, which narrows the vehicle lane for each direction. As I was in this narrow part, a minivan tried to squeeze past me (rather than wait until I was through the bend). Came so close he brushed against me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The bike lane ends near the intersection with fort and foul bay. Well before the end of the bike lane cars will drive right into the lane to make a right turn towards downtown and cut off bikes. Today a car did that but I was in the lane and pinched me onto the sidewalk.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
A pedestrian crossed the separated cycle lane right in front of me, without looking. There was a bus stopped by the kerb which blocked her view.
Didn't apologise, claimed she had looked. I narrowly missed crashing into her.
Some pedestrians are not used to looking when crossing cycle lanes.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Headed straight west across Foul Bay. As I approached the stop bar, truck turning left onto Haultain to head east nearly hit me as the driver cut the corner so sharply he passed to the right of me, between me and the curb.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: There is a small alleyway before the McDonalds restaurant that cars may use abruptly to escape the traffic jams on marine drive. A driver turned into the alleyway as I was riding in the bike lane. I hit the side of his car and hyperexteded his side view mirror as I fell off the bike. No injury.

i_type: Fall
details: slid on luas tracks

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Coasting down a big hill near the end of my ride - probably going 40kph on a 50 kph road. Vehicle wanted to take exit to SAIT, which required crossing the painted bike lane. I can only guess that they were texting or something because there is no absolutely no reason they shouldn't have seen me.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: While crossing a zebra crossing with my 4 year old son. A cyclist came at spleen towards us and failed to stop. The cyclist struck me and was knocked off her bike

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Stopped at the intersection between the trail to UVic and Gordon Head Road to hit the button to use the cross walk. Car stopped and lights started to flash so I assumed it was safe to cross the road but as soon as a started moving, the car did too. Continued a start/stop game all the way across.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Pedestrian just stepped off the pavement, into my path on the CS2 h'way with his back towards me, walking in the same direction as I was travelling. I shouted but he was on his mobile. I braked, but didn't manage to fully stop. He stayed standing but I came off the bike.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was crossing at the intersection, riding on the sidewalk (bikes are not permitted on the road on Mayor Magrath Drive). A large truck was turning right (North) and rolled through the intersection because the distracted driver was looking at his phone. He nearly hit my rear tire as I spead up to avoid his bumper.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Traffic backed up on Boundary. Red light for them, walk signal for me. I started to cross Boundary (E to W). After passing 1st lane, I peeked into next lane. Car sped past & would've hit me if I were an inch further. Driver was staring at phone in lap. I banged on rear window. He sped up.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Quickly-turning SUV squeezed me out of my lane, shoving me onto the sidewalk. I slammed the side of the vehicle with flat of my hand as I was going down.  Driver stopped 1/3 of the way into the next block, remained in vehicle, & drove off after cyclist behind me helped me to my feet.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Heading north on Gordon. The light at Wellington was green so had some speed. Car turning right on Surrey right in front of bike. I hit the passenger side of the car, went over handlebars and along pavement.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle came up from behind me close, honking to get out of the way. I pulled to the side and it sped past me. The roadway is very narrow with two-sided auto parking. Car should not have approached so closely or tried to squeeze by.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Buzzed by a motorist

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was going west on the 29 bike route down the hill just past the school (no stop sign). A taxi driver was going south on Inverness, blew his stop sign, and he was going fast! I barely stopped in time (my rims were wet and there was little warning). He wasn't able to stop in time. Close one!

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I slowed approaching roundabout to turn R into Grove Rd from A4020. I indicated R clearly and was ON the roundabout and oncoming car travelling E just kept coming like I wasn't there. I had 2 flashing front lights, a neon orange helmet, white jersey and arm warmers with a fluo yellow gilet and  had

i_type: Fall
details: I was riding the E&N trail.  A driver who was proceeding east went through a stop sign.  I braked hard and came to a complete stop however because I was clipped in, I fell striking my upper arm on a fence post between the path and the railroad tracks resulting in a broken shoulder

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
From company report:
Employee turned off Dunsmuir Street into alleyway before Richards Street. Before turning into the alleyway the employee checked their mirrors, shoulder checked and began to make turn when cyclist ran into side of vehicle. Police and ambulance attended. Cyclist was able to walk.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Pedestrian stepped out in front of me from the pavement, as I was cycling on the inside of stationary traffic.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I signaled left to indicate that I was moving into the vehicle lane to avoid a construction barrier and the driver of a black car decided to accelerate and move into oncoming traffic nearly missing myself and an oncoming vehicle.  Unfortunately I did not get the licence plate or model of car.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was on the roundabout turning R to head down argyle road and a car drove straight onto the roundabout from my L. I slowed to prevent a collision.  The driver basically drove like I had no right of way

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I have to take the lane to ride on this road (1/3 of the full lane) to avoid the countless potholes along this road. Multiple cars passed me way to close sending me back onto the uneven surface and gutter. No impacts or falls, ... at least not this time...

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cut off by impatient taxi driver right through intersection.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Southbound driver on Clearbrook turned right onto SFW from slip lane into space I was occupying. I had to swerve into other lane to avoid being hit. Driver looked right at me and did not react at all. Wearing hi-vis, lights on.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was heading west on 10th Ave. and as I approached Main St. I saw that the White walking pedestrian sign on, so I proceeded straight.  As I went into the intersection I sensed/heard a car coming from the left.  The car had just ran the red light and hit me and I flew off of my bike.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The west side of Blackwolf Blvd. is not aligned with the east side at Uplands Blvd. I arrived at the intersection just before a truck. As I proceeded through the intersection I had to move left to avoid running into the curb on the other side, but the truck did not move left to stay in his lane, and so I nearly hit his door.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The road was dangerous (busy and gravel covered), there was no bike lane, and the trail behind the strip mall was really wet/impassable. I saw the car coming out of the commercial driveway, stopped, made eye contact, and then proceeded through. He looked the other way, came out, and broadsided me.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Dark and raining at the time. Pedestrian steps out in front of my path. Had to brake hard and swerve around him. I have a bright front light and helmet front lights.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A car overtook a slow moving bus behind me. The car was speeding and lost control when pulling back into the left lane. The car smacked my bike with the side of his car and knocked me off and drove off without stopping.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car going opposite direction turned left and tried to beat us when the light turned green. It got past us but the car behind them ALSO tried to bolt through and would have hit my and our two kids all on bikes if we hadn't noticed and stopped. Luckily my 5 yr old noticed the car and stopped.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The driver positioned the cars bumper close to my rear wheel, holding steady speed for a moment.  After a few moments, I heard the driver accelerate the vehicle into the back wheel of my bike. The driver stopped briefly, then sped away. It was a black SUV.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was going down the steep part of the hill on Heather Street. A parked car pulled out right in front of me no signaling or other warning.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Had to bail on to the adjacent sidewalk after a car, travelling in the same direction as me, cut to close to the curb as they turned the slight bend in the road. Driver did not stop/notice.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car stopped at stop sign on Northwood Street, signaled to make a left turn. Bicyclist signaled entry to the adjacent bike path heading toward Dougall. Car switched signals and decided to turn right instead and proceeded to hit bicyclist as they were entering the sidewalk. Car driver yelled angrily.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Collision with moving object or vehicle
Collision with moving object or vehicle
Fall
details: Crashed on section of bridge that has a 'grating'. VERY slippery when braking. I hit the brakes and fell hard on left knee. Opened up knee requiring visit to Emergency Dept of local hospital. $300+ damage to bike as well.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Close pass by lorry truck then cut off with a left hook as driver pulled into Kanagawa Fish Market

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was in the middle lane (e.g. between N and S lanes), trying to enter traffic to turn off Sprague and a truck turned into the same middle lane, but was only looking at oncoming traffic in a S-bound direction. In other words, wasn't looking at all at what was in that middle lane (me).

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver of BC licence plate DD7 52F black Volkswagon GTI overtook with only centimetres to spare. We were both in the left lane. The right lane was completely open.  I live in this block so ride in this block rather than diverting to Off-Broadway.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: This dark wet night, I witnessed a cyclists with no light while cycling in a pedestrian zone, avoid a man walking a dog only to collide with an elderly lady.  She was thrown to the ground and split her chin.  Her son called an ambulance. I passed again 15 later but everyone had gone.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Waiting for oncoming traffic left turn lane to time out and for all lanes to be green.   No cars there turning left.   When green, rode SW (away from UVic).  A car drove thru the turn lane and turned W on Cedar Hill Cross Rd.  It saw me late, and sped to turn and beat me! I breaked hard to avoid.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Multiple close passes on Walkley Rd in the span of about 30 minutes
Video link is here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TZGQuFSnVPs

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Hospital

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car driver planning to make right turn. Heavy car traffic, slow moving . Car edged over into bike lane before making turn, did not see bicycle.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle passed me as I was cycling down Borden towards MacKenzie. Driver went into opposing lane. Driver in the opposing lane slammed on his brakes. Driver that was passing me, swerved in front of me, and I slammed on my brakes to avoid her hitting me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The traffic backed up to alley heading W on 3rd, I was heading E. More traffic came W, but saw I was waiting to turn in the alley so the lead vehicle, an suv, stopped on the east side of the alley, as to not block it. Car pulled out & accelerated up the right hand side, then slammed brakes at me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
I was heading downhill on a one-way st when I encounterd a vehicle coming towards me the wrong way.  I stopped in the road to alert the driver who moved around me a gave a "sorry" smile and a wave. 
No sooner had I continued when another vehicle came speeding towards me again going the wrong way .

i_type: Fall
Collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
I was commuting on my bike and happened upon this accident minutes after it occurred.  

(You should include an option to report  incidents as an observer/bystander)

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was cut off by a Calgary Transit bus driver as I approached the shafted stop-box. The driver hit the gas in an attempt to pass me on the left, but was still alongside me when they turned sharply across my lane to get to the bus stop adjacent to the intersection, forcing me to stop suddenly and move into the vehicle lane to get around the bus.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Cyclist hit pothole in bike lane.  Went over the bars.   Succumbed to head injuries six days later.   Report filed on behalf of the deceased, Juri Oja

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle buzzed by me very close while accelerating excessively. Not much room for bikes/cars to share this space and hill means bikes are going slow.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: My friend and I were biking on a very quiet street. A car was stopped ahead, driver talking to someone in his yard. A fast gray mini drove behind us, passed dangerously close, and then drove around the stopped car and partially onto the lawn on which the person was standing in order to drive past.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cyclist in Crosswalk crossing two lanes first lane of cars were stopped second lane car did not stop

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Light turned green, went straight. Car turning left to go west on Uni Ave turned into my front tire.  Driver then drove off before I could get their license plate. Hit and run.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: 3 times at the same intersection (Gordon and Lawrence), I was going straight and two cars were in the oncoming lane.  the first car turns left, I have the right of way, and the second car turns left without stopping or looking to see me and swerves to not hit me as I have moved into the intersection

i_type: Fall
details: I was heading NW on Valley Drive when a black Mercedes Benz SUV turned out left from the first left driveway right in front of me. When I applied my breaks, my bike skidded out from under me and I landed on my left shoulder. I'm still hurt. My helmet saved my head. The driver quickly left the scene.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: No crosswalk even tho trail continues.  Cross 5 lanes and 2 let me pass but 3rd never saw me. Very close. Sidewalk not cut down either side as well

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: No crosswalk on a well traveled trail. Crossing 5 lanes and lane 3 did not see me. Sidewalk not cut down either side

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: the International Stage Lines bus (DL: 4632 DP) passed me then proceeded to follow the road turning right squeezing me within inches between the bus' back wheels and the curb.  I had to brake to a stop to avoid being crushed between the bus and the curb or worst ending up under the bus.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car turned right into my path.  This happens a lot on this stretch of bikeway.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Riding downhill on Dunsmuir when I was passed by a speeding SUV. He then signalled and turned right into a driveway. I reacted as quickly as I could and braked hard, but there was not enough time to stop and I collided with his right rear panel and then fell over. He said he "didn't see me."

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was about to cross Blenkinsop road and a car going North stopped to let me cross. A car heading South was turning left when a truck behind this car swerved around to keep moving. The truck's view was probably obstructed.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Was heading north on Bank street. There was a row of parked cars in the far right lane with occasional gaps but mostly full.  A man in a car passed me on the left with about 6 inches to spare without moving over at all and yelled "move the f*** over". I caught up to him at the lights.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Access is controlled (only southbound autos allowed to access road + bikes from all directions). Drivers often do not obey restriction. Close calls at this location on 3+ days. Drivers aggressive when asked not to break law at this location. Drivers drive threateningly (attempt to run bike off road)

i_type: Fall
details: A person travelling west fell and scraped her left leg.  She was wobbly alongside the tracks, which are the only flat part where you can cross Eramosa Rd.  She told me she didn't get her wheel caught in the tracks (that's what I initially thought) and that it was her first time cycling this year.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle backing out of driveway quickly. Served to avoid collision.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Traffic stopped. Driver pulls into parking on side of road. Crosses bike lane without right shoulder check. Stops car angled across blocking 100% of bike lane when sees me stopping to avoid collision.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Aggressive close pass

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Large black SUV turned right, onto 107st,without yielding to cyclist (me). I could not stop on wet pavement and slide into vehicle.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car travelled or drifted into bike lane on side of street where the vehicle lane shifts to the left. Because there were no cars parked, I had room to maneuver into the designated parking area, but the car stayed in the bike lane for about half a block ahead of me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was riding straight through the two way stop intersection. A driver who was waiting at the south stop sign on  Manitoba turned left to go westbound on 18th before I got through the intersection. She saw me & made eye contact, then turned left suddenly very close to me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A cyclist coming towards me cut the corner and collided with me knocking me out and the  cyclist didn't even stay to help me

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was cycling in the right lane passing two young female cyclists who were cycling in the left lane. A white late 80s/early 90s Dodge pickup truck with license plate LK 6880 tried to pass us by trying to drive through both lanes between us. When he couldn't he revved his engine and tried to hit me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Was entering 104st and 102ave intersection, through green light. Motorist was attempting illegal right turn from 104st NB to 102ave. If she wasn't forced to yield to EB traffic, I would have been hit.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: As I headed southbound, car headed northbound moved into left-turning lane and stopped in intersection before turning left. As I approached intersection, car started to make left turn in front of me, forcing me to swerve. It stopped in the middle of the southbound lane as I missed it by a few feet.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Right on Red is explicitly forbidden at this intersection, yet driver turned right on red (and on my green) from 109 St onto 102 Ave. I had a hard time braking in time on wet road and skidded.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was headed straight on a separated bidirectional track. The vehicle was turning right, across the cycle tracks. We both had a green light. I sped up through the intersection to avoid being hit by the turning car.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Left turn on the turning advance, a car ran the read going N on 109th street, and the car in front of me stopped. This caused me to rear-end them (but luckily not get hit by the car running the red).

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle passed within a couple of inches. I was approximately 60 to 70cm from curb. Car made no effort to go around me as it passed.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Started to turn left on a green light with advance green for left turns from 116 street onto 87 ave. As I was finishing the turn a car heading east on 87 ave slams on the brakes (heard screeching tires behind me) so as not to hit me and then proceeds to continue to run the red light.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: There is an ever growing pothole in the southbound lane nearest the center of the road here. It started out about 8 inches across and has grown to nearly 3 feet long over the course of the last 5 months.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Travelling southbound on the Main St cycle track, a vehicle exiting Toronto St would have T-boned me, had I not stopped. 

The driver stated that they did not see me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cycling north on Victoria Road which has a rough gravel shoulder - passing cars roared by - scarily close to my elbow.   It sure would be nice to have a dedicated bike lane on both sides of Victoria Road.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Riding my bike home from the YMCA , riding East on Kortright Rd. Crossing through the intersection of Kortright and Edinburgh Rd S., and the driver of the car made a right turn  West onto Kortright from Edinburgh. He smashed into the back of my bike as I was already in the intersection.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Silver BMW stopped at the Stop sign and continued driving into me. I did not have a stop sign on 14th Ave. I flew off the bike. I was too shocked to stay and take the details. Continued to work and later noticed bike damage and had whiplash for a week.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Student driver failed to look over right side before turning into Solstice parking lot.  Completely cut off, I ran right into them at 40 km/hr+. This happens all the time at these lights coming North on Gordon as well, drivers just aren't checking their right side. Beware folks. Ride safe.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Turning left into parking lot and large truck waiting to turn into the road started to pull out as I turned before we both slammed on brakes. No other traffic around and I was signalling left with arm signal and in a left turn lane.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Traffic in 2 lanes stationary due to how busy it is at that time of the morning.  Cycle lane free flowing as no obstructions.  Heading slightly downhill towards junction.  Car comes across from other side of the road on Mt Alexander Rd (heading NW) turning into Mooltan St.  Cuts across, didn't look.

I already had entered the intersection and was forced to brake hard to avoid a collision causing me to go over handlebar.  Concussion & broken arm. Driver claims to have stopped.

details: bike lane disappears and road narrows... pushed into curb almost losing control

details: Two cars pulled out in front of me in the new green lane for the drive thru

details: Vehicle (LP# 231 SGK) passed by me within inches before swerving in front of me and slamming on the brakes to turn left. I spoke with him soon after in the parking lot and he said: "do you know how many people like you I've sent to hospital?".

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Riding in my "bike lane" and car door swung fully open clipping my pedal. The bike and I went flying. I was seriously bruised by fortunately nothing else.

i_type: Fall
details: I was riding my bike from Big Bend to Skinker down Delmar Blvd. The front tire of my bike got caught in the new trolley track.  I was not going too fast but the bike flipped and I fell my face down. I chipped my tooth and ended up getting a root canal. I had several superficial and deep cuts as well

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

Fly6 video available.

i_type: Fall

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:

He then yelled abuse at me and revved the engine again.

Gore Avenue needs some cycling infrastructure.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Was protecting my lane while riding with kids in front of me on a narrow street with cars parked on either side. We ride this way to school so we can prevent motor vehicles from trying to pass too closely on narrow road. Motor vehicle approached from behind and pulled inside to get around us

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Heading home on E&N Trail, stopped at intersection. Light went green and started to cross. Car heading north ran red light and hit me. Bike took the hit. Grazed shoulder and elbow and rolled ankle. Bike replaced by ICBC as frame damaged. Now I always look both ways, even at traffic lights!

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

Painful bump, knocked off bike but somehow no real injury or bike damage.  Driver very apologetic :)

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Waiting to turn left, car drove over hilltop and almost hit me from behind.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

Collision with moving object or vehicle
Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: There's a big tree with large protruding roots on the middle of the bike trail. There is no signaling and since the roots are large and big enough to have damaged the entire width of the pavement on the cycling path. My bike flew over these roots and I fell.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was riding west on 19th, and a car was coming out of the lane slowly going north.  I thought the car was going to stop, but instead it accelerated and it was too late for me to stop.  I put out my foot and jumped off the front bumper.  The driver stopped  and I regained control without falling.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Motorcycle pulled into the bike lane to get around traffic stopped at a light

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car passed by me at high speed with 6-12in of space between me & vehicle.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Walking bicycle across Carling Avenue at lights. Car didn't not see the light and drove through red light.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was signaling to turn right and a car didn't even see me in the daylight. Treated me like I wasn't there like I was a ghost. They drove around me, luckily I'm cautious as I know drivers here don't treat bikers with respect. And turn right in front of me . Instead of behind me.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: The barricades at the end of the road are narrow and have hooks on them.  The hook caught my pannier and I fell over.  A similar accident happened previously.  This is a route that I frequently take when cycling with my children due to the quiet side streets.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle

details: SUV went around the concrete divider, drove along separated bike path, then hopped the curb and drove along sidewalk.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

About a block before this happened, she rolled down her window got my attention and expressed her opinion about my route choice.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Waiting to turn left, vehicle pulled up behind me honking horn. Driver veered left into oncoming traffic to pass me, clipping me with his side mirror.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Another bicyclist and I were heading west on York, cruising down the hill. Driver heading south blew through the stop sign without slowing down only a few meters in front of us, causing us both to slam on our brakes. Would have been a collision if either of us cyclists had been a few meters ahead.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: As I was stopped at Erie & Superior at the 3-way stop, I noticed the white Ford F-150 (MH8193) approaching,  As I was taking off again, the truck did NOT stop and went straight through the stop sign and cut in front of me., nearly taking me out.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver swerved left into bike lane through the intersection with Bleecker to pass a left-turning car, almost side-swiping a cyclist

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was cycling on the galloping goose trail where it crosses atkins rd, pedestrian crossing. I was halfway across when a car drove across in front of me. I had to brake hard to avoid collision.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: As of July 2018 the painted bike lane heading east on 105 gives no warning that it turns into a separated bike track on the left side. A vehicle turning right from 116 onto 105 going eastbound didn't see me coming and I had to band their hood to stop them from pushing me into oncoming traffic

i_type: Fall
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was biking at the Northcrest Plaza. Stopped at the stop sign to turn left. Truck behind me sped past me on my left blowing through the stop sign nearly hitting me and the car who was stopped on the other side. I had words with him. Almost got violent.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I arrived at a small traffic circle from the east and entered the intersection at a good speed (~15km/hr). A vehicle approached from the north approach (too my right meaning I had the right-of-way) and did not slow approaching the traffic circle. Luckily I cleared just before the vehicle.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was <100metres from my house, going 1 block to access a less busy street, I was in the MIDDLE of the Right hand lane on Commercial, and a speeding BMW almost clipped me. He could have used the left hand, north bound lane, but just swerved at the last minute. 1st ave construction blow back?

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was on the O'Connor segregated bidirectional bike lanes heading North. A four-door sedan heading East on Waverly stopped at O'connor then continued to cross O'Connor as I was approaching the intersection. I had to emergency break and was probably 1 meter from the car. He too stopped.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car attempted to overtake me on a narrow stretch of road with curb on right side of road and median in the middle. Would have clipped handle bars if he completed passing me but stopped when I yelled at him to back off.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: 73 bus reg BUS 038 close passed and pulled in several times (4) as we passed each other and he stopped

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: At a 4-way stop, the southbound driver accellerated towards a cyclist (in front if me), who was already in the intersection. The cyclist yelled at the driver following the near-miss, and both continued their path.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver of SUV was turning left out of an alleyway and did not look for cyclists.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A white work van failed to signal when turning at the intersection and cut into the bike lane a couple of feet in front of me. I could tell by the vehicle language that they were turning, but there was not signal and it could have been considerably more dangerous.

details: A LOGAN POLICE OFFICER hit this cyclist who was turning onto 200

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Near collision with motorcycle rider as he overtook and cut me off to make left turn.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

details: While stoping for red light at Roosevelt & Richmond, southbound, 4 males in a silver car, late twenties in a silver car threw food and vegetable dip at me. They turned right onto Roosevelt then came back from the dead end, speeding as I decided to persue them.  QC J81 MEL

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Biking south on Gore Avenue. I was planning on making a left turn onto Keefer St. so I, as is proper, went in the left lane. Someone in a car behind me honked repeatedly and revved in a harassing way.
The timing of the lights on Gore (south bound at least) are timed to encourage speeding.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Veered into on narrow road by oblivious truck driver.  Had to brake hard to avoid being hit - then at next corner the same driver cut me off with left hook while turning left.  Banged on side of truck with hand to get his attention.   This street is a horror.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
SHAW Van #6040 was northbound, going around me when he swerved back into me due to a car coming the other way. 
Although he didn't appear to be speeding, he very nearly hit me as he was coming back from attempting to go around me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Southbound driver on Watson street failed to stop at the 2-way stop, so i had to hit my brakes despite having right of way.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car turned left on Burrard. Stopped to miss a pedeestrian crossing (same direction as me) and swered into me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was biking my kids to school with one on my cargobike & the other on her bike beside me. A large pickup truck towing a wide trailer came up behind us, honked at us, then passed us very closely--maybe 30cm between my elbow & his trailer.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was travelling westbound on the Street, a vehicle moved over towards my lane, I moved over further, in the middle of the intersection he proceeded to move over further, he actually stuck me on the sidewalk where it merges to the road for pedestrians.  Sustained bruising to left leg and elbow.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Less confident rider could not slow down riding down the steep hill (Westview) which is marked as a 'bike route', blowing through the stop sign at the T intersection with Rochester as it is quite steep even near the intersection, narrowly missing a car coming down Rochester.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Was heading into the roundabout at 30km/hr when a SUV came from behind and clipped my handlebars while squeezing me against the curb. Was fortunate that apart from a bruised knuckle and adrenaline that no seriouys damage to myself or the bike occurred. No one stopped.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I had just come down the hill & out of the corner of my L-eye I saw something moving. A deer ran out from someone's property & crossed the road in front of me. It was close, but not too close - I was able to use my brakes to slow down enough to avoid. S/He was moving at a very fast pace.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Was biking straight through intersection in bike lane. Car turned right in front of me and cut me off. I yelled many times and they did not notice me. I was wearing a high vis vest.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: In traffic at a four way stop, I waited for a vehicle going eastbound and then proceeded with my left turn.  The next driver in line eastbound paused at the stop sign, made eye contact with me, and then proceeded to drive at me, clipping my rear wheel with a part of their car.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A vehicle travelling south on Wayburne in right turn lane moved all the way into the marked ped/bike crossing before stopping the car. The driver almost hit me as I was on the crossing heading west. The driver failed to stop before entering the intersection before making his right turn.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Yelled at and chased out of the advisory bike lanes on 54th St by an alcohol infused lady erratically driving a white town and country mini-van, as she shouted at us, "I hate fucking cyclists." Filed police report.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: On the south side of Patterson station there is a cycle track through the main bus area, and pedestrians often walk along the separates and signed cycle track to short-cut to their bus.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Today about 3 people were standing in the bike track, listening to their earphones, waiting for their bus, completely blocking it. After ringing my bell and saying hey! Thy still didnt hear me, so I had to get off my bike and walk through them. This area is constrained between bench and wall...

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Right turning driver didn't shoulder check while turning right off of McKenzie onto Borden south and almost hit bike rider  heading straight east on Mckenzie. Rider braked right before point of impact

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver turned left onto Morningside Drive as my son and I were in the intersection travelling north on N. Greensboro St. Lady claimed she did not see us. She had dark sunglasses on, so inattention more than glare is the likeliest reason.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Left hooked by two cars using the newly installed slipway

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car turning left from Fort onto Richmond almost hit me as I went straight through the intersection and had to break suddenly in the intersection. I was wearing a bright jacket and they must not have seen me.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle

i_type: Fall
Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Stopped at a red light in a bike lane, a right turning truck to my left turned right on red through my lane, hitting my bike and my elbow with his mirror and rear end of his pickup. Not sure if he even knew he hit someone - I yelled but he did not stop.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cars at this intersection use bike lane as an additional merge lane onto bridge, I am often side swiped by cars here. This particular incident knocked me off my bike. The car fled away. Hit and run.

i_type: Fall
details: Wet pavement, 3 cyclist's together in drafting group, me 1st - 2nd cyclist went over a manhole cover, bike went down at approx 35-40KPH - Cyclist fractured collarbone, Pelvis and hip.  Experienced severe pain in back and pelvis - unable to walk - Currently recovering - now at 2 months post accident

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle made a right hand turn in front of me resulting in my crashing and fracturing my hip and elbow.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A truck, possibly construction vehicle, turned right off of highway 1 trying to cross the bike path and had to stop suddenly to avoid hitting me. I thought this has been closed to car traffic?  Seemed like an illegal right turn. i had to brake and swerve.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Coming off the Gateway Trail at Brady Street, motor vehicles don't heed the stop sign....often rolling through or stopping well after the sign and the trail end intersection.  Always double check.   Young female driver was on her phone.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Pollock road gate gap is pretty narrow and only has enough room for one cyclist at a time despite two way bike traffic. Some times it's hard to tell the distance you need to clear the gap with your handlebars, especially wider flat bars.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: As I rode straight toward the intersection on a green light, in the bike lane, a car overtook me from behind then took a sudden right hand turn in front of me ( a right hook) onto Blenkinsop Rd. I had to slow and swerve to avoid.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A driver honked and yelled at me while passing too closely, even though there was ample room to pass and no other traffic. He didn't appreciate my hand gesture and swerved right to cut me off. I veered left toward the centerline to avoid his vehicle, and he again swerved to obstruct my path.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was running on the East sidewalk SB. A cyclist was riding on the same sidewalk in the opposite and correct direction but at a high rate of speed.  The sidewalk was too narrow for the two of us at that rate of speed. There were other cyclists in the bike lane that he was apparently trying to pass.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: SUV two lanes to the left decided he really wanted to get in the gas station, merged across both lanes of traffic directly into my path as I was riding in the rightmost lane. Collision left a large dent in his SUV and a broken fork on my bike.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I dismounted my bike to more easily cross the lighted pedestrian controlled crosswalk. I pressed the light and began crossing the street after a short pause. The vehicles on the near lane stopped, but a large pickup truck sped through the other lane heading South West towards Blanshard.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: As I was approaching the intersection a dump truck passed slightly to the left of me and then began moving right and forced me from the lane. Had I not moved to my right, the truck would have killed me.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A car exited a parking lot (out of inlet drive and hit me). fractured clavicle and un-repairable bike damage

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: White car wanted to move on the Green Bicycle Light instead of obeying the Red Vehicle Stop Light.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Early morning, forget the exact date, but it was the middle of the month.
Clear morning, and a vehicle (forget the type or colour) decided to turn left on the green bicycle light and red vehicle stop light. I watch my surroundings and came to a stop before I drove into them or they hit me.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Bikelane just ends, suppose 2 merge across 80km/h offramp, no right of way despite cyclist logos painted across lane. So stupid. No one yields.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cyclist traveling southbound on Interurban hit by car turning right on Marigold. Cyclist was conscious but dazed and needing assistance to get off the ground.  Unknown injuries.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Motor vehicle turned left from Columbus Ave on a green ball (permitted left) without noticing I was approaching. I applied emergency braking, stopped just before entering the street as the car whizzed by 2 ft in front of me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Heading straight west of Colville, some parked cars, so moving to allow vehicles to pass when no cars. Car passed me closely as I was passing a parked car, then driver swerved quickly back into our lane, and slammed on the brakes a few m further down the road.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: While I was going east on Quebec, a vehicle turned right across my path just before I entered the intersection. I had to break hard to avoid hitting the vehicle's side. Need signal phase-separation of through bicycles/right-turn cars with a protected intersection!

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Myself and my kids were stopped at the crosswalk with our bikes on the west side and a pedestrian was crossing from the east side. i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: An older woman in a silver sedan side swiped me, knocking me from my bicycle. The impact caused the chain to fall off and me to fall sideways in the road.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Fall

My jacket, gloves & pants were damaged $350
Serious road rash to temple, elbow & knee.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

details: Car passed us riding 2 abreast within one foot

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car ran a red light at a pedestrian / bike crossing and hit me side on.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was heading north on Windsor through the traffic circle @ 21st.  Driver heading West on 21st didn't look and didn't see me at all.  I entered the traffic circle first and had the right of way but I had to brake hard. Fortunately I noticed that he was not looking at me beforehand and so I was ready

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Agressive driver coming up from behind.  Shouting I was in wrong lane (this section is unmarked as 2 lanes but is wide) - I was setting up for left turn on left 1/2 of road riding steady.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car entered bike lane, while I was beside them.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle travelling southbound on vine stopped at the stop sign, the proceeded through the intersection. I was travelling east on York with ROW. I almost t-boned the car, but was able to stop just before colliding. Motorists stop but only give a cursory glance before proceeding and the result is near misses and collisions.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Yesterday, I saw a car and a bike almost hit each other at the intersection of Innes Rd and Orchardview Ave, It was around 7:10PM when a cyclist coming off the pathway which run along the power line enter the roadway without stopping then used the crosswalk without getting off his bike. Due to the sunset condition, the cyclist was difficult to see and luckily enough the driver making the right turn was very careful doing so.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Travelling S on Walker when a passing pickup clipped me with its right mirror.  I wobbled and bounced off the side of the truck but remained upright. I sustained some abrasions from the side of the truck.  The driver did not stop and based on his behavior while driving away and turning with me in pursuit (not speeding or looking in his mirrors) I doubt he knew he hit me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
This was a mix of right turn/head on. I was stopped in the left tire well of the westbound lane of Jessie Ave preparing to turn south into the two way bike lane on the east side of Pembina when a northbound vehicle on Pembina Highway turned right, overshooting the appropriate eastbound lane of Jessie and came straight at me. The vehicle eventually passed to my right (traveling counterflow into the oncoming lane of traffic).

I had a bright front headlight on my handlebars.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
The intersection is very dangerous. Cars and Trucks turning are watching for a gap in traffic, and when they see it, they come fast.

The Intersection at 97 has a left turn lane from the centre of the highway.
I was crossing from west to east, and a truck turning left onto Sutherland sped across both oncoming lanes and never saw me.

There's 100 meters or less of bike path on the north side of Sutherland, avoid it, it goes nowhere, and does nothing but put you at risk of this same corner.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was positioned in the centre left turning lane on EB Roslyn Rd in a line vehicles also turning left onto NB Osborne when a vehicle from the right lane on EB Roslyn Rd made an illegal left turn through the intersection and nearly side-swipped me as I completed my turn to the right hand lane of Osborne St.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver merged into roundabout without proper check and almost drove me over.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The cyclist in front of me made a sudden stop at the intersection while they had the right of way. The vehicle had come to a full stop at the cross walk. I was able to stop in time without hitting the cyclist in front of me, however the cyclist behind me collided with the back of my bike, and the cyclist behind them collided with them.  The cyclist that collided with me apologized and stated that they didn't want to hit the bollards.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
