details: The driver of a westbound pickup truck took a left turn (south) too sharply and drove directly into me. It's clear he misjudged the angle of the intersection because 33rd doesn't align north and south of Oklahoma. Based on his behavior and verbiage, I suspect he was drunk.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: the car driver didnt want to give the way to the e-scooter driver

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was walking my bike through the crosswalk, heading east towards takhini arena. There was a long line of cars heading south on range towards 2 mile hill.  I had a near miss with a vehicle who was traveling in the northbound direction, who didn't see me until the last minute. They had to swerve; we were both distraught from the incident (I could see them yelling at me from their car but could not hear what they said).

i_type: Fall
details: Fall caused by root bump in road surface.  Numerous broken bones, ambulance ride, eight day hospital stay

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Angry driver honked and revved engine directly behind me, yelled sexist slurs, and swerved at me, which lead to me having to veer off the road and into the parked cars/onto the sidewalk. I believe this was triggered by me waving to make sure the driver had seen me, since he did not stop at the stop sign and nearly hit me shortly before this happened.

White Tesla model S, company branding. Didn't get a good look or licence plate.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A black suv was turning left out of the long driveway here. It didn't see me and I was going too fast to stop completely. I slowed and my bike went into their front left wheel well. I don't remember how but i fell/ was forced off my bike and thrown onto the road. The drivers then drove around me and left. A guy wearing a cardigan came and checked on me (Thank you cardigan guy) and called the SBPD who then drove me and my bike home.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle initiated left turn from westbound Campus Wy onto southbound 26th without signal after I had entered intersection. Vehicle stopped before collision and we both continued.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
right hooked.
light was red at intersection but there is right turn lane and driver doesn't look before turn.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: vehicle merged into right turn lane without looking.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: off leash dog  that owner said was fine,   jumped in front of me causing me to lock up brakes and go over handle bars.  Dr. thought i broke my neck but turned out to be herniared disc that requires surgery and also lower back sciatica problems

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: As I was approaching Chapala on anapamu Street, a car zoomed up from behind me, so if they could turn left as the light changed. I had to use my brakes and shout at the man who did not respond.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car rolled through red light turning right off 15 South offramp onto Camino del Rio South. I was riding through the intersection with a green light towards the bike path entrance on the far side of the intersection.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Biking to Big Brothers Big Sisters to pick up some games and indoor activities, was close-passed by a motorist. Happened to catch up to them and stopped to get a good look at the driver for police report. Driver indicated she didnt give room because there was oncoming traffic. Basically admitted she saw me and made a conscious decision not to slow down but to endanger my life.

Police report filed, they made mistakes and it never went to court. She got away with it.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver turned right while I was in the bike lane next to the car.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Near miss that happened when rider was turning right

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: It was late at night and the biker was on the sidewalk and almost hit a pedestrian because the pedestrian could not hear the bike coming. This is the biker's fault for not riding in the bike lane.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle in the left turn lane heading South went straight when the light turned green veering into me on my bicycle also heading South in the adjacent lane. I was surprised by them not turning left and had to move out of their way to avoid a collision.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was cycling in a painted bike gutter along Riccarton Rd and a car overtook me and immediately turned left acros the bike lane. I had to slam on my brakes to avoid hitting the rear left of the car as it cut me off. I assume they didn't see me at the time as they didn't acknowledge anything had happened and drove off to look for parking presumably.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The bike lane is separated from the road here, shared with the sidewalk, but a green dotted bike lane crosses the side street every block. The vehicle did not check the sidewalk or bike lane before attempting to turn right and nearly hit me as I crossed the side street.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
https://vancouver.citynews.ca/2023/03/06/north-vancouver-cyclist-dies/
A cyclist has died after they were hit by a commercial vehicle in North Vancouver Monday morning.

According to the North Vancouver RCMP, the crash happened just before 10:30 a.m. near the intersection of Lonsdale Avenue and 23rd Street.
Despite life-saving measures from officers at the scene, police say she was later pronounced dead.

The RCMP has identified the cyclist as a woman in her 40s from North Vancouver.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
riding on a main artery street, entered a T-intersection, where a minor street runs into the main street, a van turned left from the main street into the minor street, and broadsided me on the left side.  
Tendon and ligament damage to both knees and shoulders, torn meniscus in one knee, labrum tear in one shoulder.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car ran the stop sign at a high rate of speed resulting in an emergency stop by friend on bike.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: turning left from Bike lane to bike lane.  Arm signalled to turn left and had the driver behind me drive into me as I turned

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Elderly driver w/accessibility hangtag was driving north down the slope towards E 6th Ave. Driver didn't stop at sign, barely slowly down. I had to yell at the car for having cut me off in the middle of the shared pedestrian intersection path. The car stopped and remained in the middle of the path as I had to suddenly stop, almost falling off my bike because of sudden deceleration to avoid hitting the car itself. The driver looked slightly stunned at having to stop and tried waving me through.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cycling south on Gladstone past a back lane, vehicle headlights were observed coming from the left (East). Vehicle did not stop upon approaching Gladstone and had to suddenly slow and stop as I yelled at the car about to run me over (1.5m space between car and bike).

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car did not yield at marked bike crossing nearly running me over.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: two cars failed to slow and stop for multi-use path crossing range road. A collision almost occured.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Heading eastbound on the Pandora bike lane and attempting  to walk long cargo bike across Cook St heading south to reach the daycare on south corner of Cook and Pandora. Wait for walk symbol, started to walk then a vehicle approached, and I paused to make eye contact. They slowed and I started again, then they decided to just pin the gas and turn wide just nearly missing my child and I.  There should be a advanced pedestrian walk phase at this intersection.

i_type: Fall
details: Daughter slipped on ice and fell of bike during commute to school. Trip to the hospital and minor concussion.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Van honked throughout passing too closely and cut in front cyclist in order to make right turn onto baseline.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Training ride for my upcoming bike packing trip. Was riding with one other cyclist who was ahead of me. We had the walk sign and a green light, the car pulled up in the right had turn lane almost clipped my riding partner but despite my high vis clothing did not see me and proceeded to try to accelerate into a small gap in traffic to which I was hit. Luckily it hit my front fork so there was no damage to my person even on falling.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The stop signs along this bike path are dangerous. Drivers turning left into the neighborhoods are constantly trying to wave me into oncoming traffic when I have the stop on my bike.  For this reason and others cyclists always blow through the stop signs. It makes it feel safer to just ride in the street.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: While biking along Hollister, a delivery truck almost backed up out of the alleyway behind the stores on the E end of Storke Plaza into the bike lane while I was passing. The driver had their window down and stopped about a foot away from my bicycle when it became clear that they were not stopping and I yelled at them that I was there.

i_type: Fall
details: J'tais  vlo sur la rue St-Jude Nord  Granby, il y a des gros trous(nids-de-poule ) tout le long de la rue St-Jude Nord  Granby. J'ai voulu viter un des nombreux trous sur la rue et de ce fait viter une voiture, beaucoup de vhicules circulent sur cette rue dont des gros camions, des autobus, des camions de type pick-up et je suis arrive dans un trou et j'ai tomb par terre.J'avise la ville de Granby depuis 7 ans de la dangerosit spcifiquement sur cette rue et rien n'est fait

i_type: Fall
details:
I had a hard fall this morning on my commute to work. The section of the bike path just south of the roundabout is often flooded or covered in ice. This morning dipped below 0 degrees and I couldn't make it over the ice without falling. 
This is an infrastructure failing. There are many sections of bike paths with no drainage, and this is one of them. It causes a hazard that many people have to avoid every morning.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Northbound vehicle made a left turn into Yukon Inn and almost hit me riding in the bike lane.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: DOORED while riding in the De La Vina bike lane. :-(((

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
I was waiting with my family to cross Gore Road heading North on the bike path on Highway 15. The bike lights turned green, and my 5-year-old began to proceed through. A red SUV, with veteran's plates starting with 4V, turned right off Hwy 15 and almost hit my child. It then continued East on Gore.

It could have led to severe injury or death if I hadn't yelled stop and my child had not reacted so fast.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Driver parked on path

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cyclists hit me going into embarcadero hall since the cut me off

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: The people crashed into each other

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Crashed into someone passing me at the roundabout

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Taking my child to school on our daily route, was in the marked bike lane on Finlayson. Going through a green light I was almost side-swiped by a white SUV turning right onto Quadra. I braked hard and it missed me, but the driver did not appear to have seen me before, during or after the near-collision. There were crossing guards active at the intersection but the driver didn't seem to be paying much attention to them either.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was traveling westbound on Hollister through the Fairview intersection. Vehicle traveling south on Fairview making a right turn onto Hollister in the westbound direction rolled through a red light causing me to swerve and brake hard to avoid collision. I was wearing reflective vest, but maybe morning sunrise made it hard to see me. A lot of vehicles roll that turn/intersection anyways.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was on the bike path headed west and stopped on the type Q quadrupole bicycle detector.  The bicycle light turned green and I started across the intersection.  I stopped quickly because a car advanced to make a right turn in front of me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I had stopped in the center of the eastbound lane behind the limit line on Cook St. and waited to cross Broadway.  The light turned and I crossed riding in the right lane which is marked with sharrows. A driver in a black jeep passed very very close (6-12") on my left in my lane.  I yelled. He turned right on McClelland which was where I was going.  I saw he had parked at the library so I called out to him. He ignored me. He was an older man about 65. I walked over to him, he didn't respond.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Biking on the multiuse path with my 10 year old son. He crossed a driveway ahead of me and a driver coming too fast out of the condo parking lot didn't see him at first but stopped in time to not hit him. There are some shrubs but not obstucting views at slow speeds.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Entering a well marked pedestrian/bike crosswalk where drivers turning right are supposed to yield, but driver blew right through the intersection.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was riding straight along Clonsilla Road. A car was turning right onto Clonsilla Road. The car had a stop sign but ran through it and hit my rear wheel. I was knocked off my bike but mostly OK (just bruised my hip). The driver did stop to make sure I was OK. They said they couldn't see me despite having front and back bike lights and wearing a reflective safety vest. I think the collision was mostly because the driver was not paying attention or expecting a bike riding on the road.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: While dismounting bike adjacent to sidewalk a vehicle turned into me while I was stopped. I was able to jump onto the hood of the vehicle once I realized what was happening. No injuries.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Almost hit by a car speeding on this bike-designated street, they were inattentive and locked their brakes at the last moment, leaving a burned rubber mark on the street.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car turning right did not shoulder check. I was in bike lane. Stopped only when I yelled out.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Riding east on 37th signaling to turn right onto Byers. Audi backs out of driveway on the north side of 37th then makes a hard left turn onto Byers directly in front of me. Had to brake hard to avoid collision. Stayed directly behind driver all the way to 33rd and Edmonton. Zero time saved at the expense of risk my life.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: J'tais dans la piste cyclable de Laurier quand un automobiliste qui sortait de la station-service m'est rentr dedans car il ne regardait pas pour des cyclistes. J'ai revol et mon vlo a subit 350$ de dommages. La policire (qui a pris 2h pour venir sur les lieux) a refus de prendre un rapport de police.

i_type: Fall
details:
The train tracks go at an angle to the road - my tire got stuck and i tumbled. This happened twice - once went to the hospital for sprained wrist. 
Now I walk over the train tracks.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Heading south on the E&N trail coming to the Esquimalt Rd intersection. As I arrived at the intersection, I had to brake hard as a person had walked across the crosswalk and was remounting their bike directly in my path. The light was green for me (and them).

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Heading northbound, I was turning left to head West on 10th by going around the round about. Car approaching southbound did not yield and stopped at last minute, narrowing avoiding a collision with me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Large group (5 people) stepped into bike lane directly in front of me without notice to jaywalk across the street

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: No injury

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car almost side swiped me

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: This is a constant collision area

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Crossing the highway entrance ramp, on the way to cross main st and get on the bridge, the rider in front of me had to slam on his brakes to avoid a speeding pickup (black dodge ram).

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Group of riders nearly missed a walker who was not paying attention. The lack of a bike lane in a location that clearly has high demand for one, as well as space for one is a clear and present danger for all involved.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Once again... folk coming up Allesandro and not stopping at the stop sign. Happens way to frequently. This morning a Jeep Grand Cherokee actually accelerated as they approached the stop sign (I only heard them due to the blind corner) with me starting through the intersection (someone coming up from the canyon actually performed a proper stop and let me have my turn to cross through the intersection as I was stopped first).
Intersection might be the most dangerous part of my ride.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Drivers don't respect the red-light

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver run the red-light

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Left turning vehicle (on permissive left) did not see me and almost hit me.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Three cars travelling westbound failed to give way when priority was for vehicles travelling in the eastbound direction. Forced me out of the lane to get through and hit my arm.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: My kid and I were on our ebike  behind 2 cyclists waiting  for the bicycle light at esquimalt rd. The light turned green and the 2 cyclists carried through, and I followed. There was a youth cycling on the sidewalk, and we collided. Aside from not expecting a cyclist on the sidewalk, the visibility from the intersection of the sidewalk and bike path where the building comes to a point is poor, and having a green light but the sidewalk active is dangerous.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car turned left out of the alley into the wrong way one way, nearly hitting me in the "lane" as he did so

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car went through the stop sign on my right without looking. Had to do an emergency stop

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
I was going eastbound on the MUP. 

Driver of a Tesla was exiting the tuner shop and turning right (westbound) onto Great Northern Way. Driver was only looking left for oncoming motor vehicles and pulled into MUP to yield to motor traffic without looking both ways, causing me to brake hard in order to avoid collision.

Driver blamed me for not being visible (daytime).

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Speeding and recklessly weaving kia (stolen?) rad the red light while we were crossing. I was towing a child trailer.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: crossing Broadway from S to N at Van Buren on crosswalk/bike path on W side of intersection with walk-light. Southbound driver on Van Buren (large pick up truck) turned right without looking (I had right of way in crosswalk, with lights on & my kid in the bike trailer). I braked hard/stopped waved my arms and yelled. Driver stopped and driver behind him nearly read-ended him, honked and pulled around him and then also nearly hit me. In the end I backed up my bike and they both continued.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: headed SW on Van Buren Street in bike lane. Fed Ex truck ahead of me pulled over and parked in bike lane (there is no on-street parking on this block), causing me to veer into traffic lane, coincidentally at the same time that an oncoming/NE-bound vehicle crossed into the SW-bound lane to give a wide berth to a cyclist in the bike lane on the NE-bound side of the street. Lots of swerving of bikes (my own and the other cyclist) and cars (the NE-bound vehicle) ensued.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Going east in the bike lane, got hit by a car turning left into a driveway at high speeds. Visibility was reduced because of parked cars between traffic and the bike lane.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle turning left off NB Main Street onto Assiniboine failed to stop at the red light and almost struck me as I was crossing at the dedicated bike crossing with right of way. I had to slam on my brakes on avoid a collision. I have witnessed many near misses here with both bikes and pedestrians. For some reason people driving vehicles turning left onto Assiniboine don't think they need to stop at the red light.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
https://vancouver.citynews.ca/2023/06/18/surrey-rcmp-cyclist-struck/

Mounties say a vehicle headed westbound hit the cyclist who was riding northbound in the crosswalk.

Members arrived on scene, and provided first aid treatment to the injured cyclist, while awaiting Emergency Health Services attendance.  The cyclist was transported to an area hospital, where they were treated for non-life threatening injuries,

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Skateboarder was going (too) fast down the prospect point hill in the car traffic lane along with cyclists. The skateboarder lost control and fell directly in the path of oncoming cyclists (including me).  Cyclists had to dodge the person and the loose skateboard.

This is after the removal of the previous cone "bike lane."

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was turning off the Meewasin Trail onto Duchess. I stopped at the crosswalk. The northbound traffic stopped and I couldn't see any cars coming in the other direction. When I was almost halfway through the intersection, a car traveling southbound slammed on its brakes and ended up stopping in the middle of the crosswalk before moving on.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was in the turning lane that allowed me to turn left. As the light turned green I turned left, while signalling with my arm. A silver SUV/crossover was turning right on their red and almost turned directly through me. I yelled to attract their attention and then to remonstrate them.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: As I was cycling North on Thickson (between Wentworth and Victoria), a semi-truck passed me with only 6" of clearance.  This stretch of road has no paved path or bike lane, and there is a lot of semi-truck traffic at all times of the day.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: A driver opened their driver door directly into the bike path without first checking for oncoming traffic. I swerved through traffic coming in tbt opposite direction to avoid the opening door.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A sedan had pulled over half-blocking the westbound bike lane on Bloor Street, and just as I was approaching I started ringing my bell. When I was about 6 feet away the side door flew open in front of me, I slammed on the brakes and yelled, and the person pulled the door back. I took a picture of the car, and the person getting out said "Just stop it, you f***ing bitch." I said "You nearly killed me." She said, "I don't f***ing care."

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was riding with my daughter as she will be cycling this route regularly in the fall.  At the base of Hilliard in the bike lane, cars are only looking left to see the flow of traffic from the North.  It is incredibly unsafe for cyclists to cross George Street at that location.  It needs a crossing like the Parkhill road rotary trail crossing for both Water St. and George street at that location.  Students attending TASS or Adam Scott cross here at least twice daily.  This could be a tragedy

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Going EB on McDermot bike lane just west of Sherbrook. SUV came from behind me and started turning right on to SB Sherbrook across my path. I had ROW; both bike and vehicle lights were green. I braked hard to a stop and yelled; they briefly stopped but then kept turning in front of me and I had to clear the intersection on yellow/red.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cycling home in the bike lane on Wisconsin I came upon a recent two-car  accident. One car was crumpled in the road and an SUV was upside down. How does a driver flip an SUV on a 35mph residential road?

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Almost t-boned a blind gray mercedes who ran the stop sign going northbound. I forgot  whether it was at 2pm or 9pm as I had multiple rides that day.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was riding south on Wallace. The driver behind me was about to pass when I realized there were two cars coming in the other direction. I put my hand out in the "stop" signal and moved more to the centre of the lane in the hopes that the driver would understand it was not safe. Thankfully she did otherwise it most definitely would have been a head-on collision right beside me, likely involving me and the car that was following the 1st approaching car.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: There is an accident on this corner pretty much every day. Visibility is terrible from every direction and it's blind going up or down the hill. Could be better as a 4-way stop or if it had better signage for bikes.

i_type: Fall
details:
Heading down 2 mile hill and there was a car merging on to 2 mile from the industrial area. I did not see it before having to hit my breaks hard and skidding on gravel. If I did not break it would have been a full collision.

Sight lines obstructed from parking at Integra Tire.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was riding southbound on the bike path along two mile hill road. A vehcile was stopped on Chilkoot at a red light. I had a green light but slowed through the intersection. The driver was only looking left at northbound traffic in an attempt to turn right on a red light. He started turning and hit me, throwing me to the ground and under his car. This was a City of Whitehorse vehicle.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was southbound on Duncan. When the crappy painted bike lane disappeared I moved to the center of the lane as the sharrows indicate. A southbound pickup truck driver elected to pass me by straddling the double yellow lane divider. As we came around the blind corner a northbound car was revealed and the truck veered sharply back into the southbound lane, forcing me to brake and veer hard to the edge of the road.  Failed infrastructure and bad driving endangered my life. Again.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: An SUV went around the concrete divider, drove along separated bike path and almost hit cyclists coming in the other direction.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: The road crew has ground down the asphalt for re paving creating a steep transition or step to the multi use sidewalk . It was like hitting a shallow 90 degree curb .

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: NB on Pacific Highway, extremely closs pass on bridge over Witherby just after bike lane disappears.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car cut me off in the bike lane. They proceeded to park in the bike lane.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Several drivers coming down the ramp wouldn't yield to me in the bike lane.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver going way over the speed limit on El Prado made a dangerously close pass.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Jogger running in the narrow on-street bike lane on Harbor Dr.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Almost rear ended by motorcycle driving in the bike lane.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver made dangerously close pass.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver tailgating me on steep hill almost rear ended me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver drove across bikeway to turn right without looking.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver cut me off to cross the 3 lanes to get to the 5.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Riding NB in 5th, car stopped on Fir st. at the stop sign but started to drive at me in the intersection. They thought I had a stop sign, but 5th doesn't have a stop sign there.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was biking northbound with my kid in a bike trailer on the bike/ped path along the side of the road and crossing the eastbound interstate on ramp when a vehicle coming north on Van Buren (and turning east onto the interstate) sped into sight underneath the railroad underpass and came uncomfortably close to hitting myself and my child. There is HORRIBLE visibility for pedestrians crossing at this intersection, it is very dangerous.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A vehicle tried to merge into my bike lane in order to access the right turn lane, they didn't look and would have hit me hat I not yelled. Fortunately, they heard me and stopped merging. Apparently, their ears are better than their eyes. Second near miss on a right has turn on this trip. Frustrating to say the least, but I live to ride another day!

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I had a near miss on Dean Ave at one of the roundabouts - probably around Carnarvon. It happened in August when the guy in his truck didn't yield and I almost smoked the side of his car but managed to brake in time and just about nicked his rear bumper. No contact occurred. It was daylight.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I hate biking this section of road every day. It's one of the worst parts of my 4.3 km commute to work.  It's uphill and just after an intersection, the road has a big dip for a storm grate and you don't want to bike through it! Cars come so close and fast to get through the light.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Traffic congestion on Tyee rd lead to people turning off onto Wilson st. Was sideswiped by a vehicle turning right onto Wilson but was able to avoid a collision

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Heading straight down road at speed vehicle passes and turns in front

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A southbound car started from a stop at the red light at the pedestrian crossing and accelerated through the light.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Coming into the intersection of the two trails another cyclist was proceeding north on the paved trail at a very high speed and swerved just in time and missed me and then continued north across the trestle bridge.  Cyclists need to proceed slowly when approaching from the north.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was travelling along Humboldt when a jeep blasted out of a parkade, turning left. I braked and shouted, my back tire lifting and nearly flipping me over. She heard me shout, laughed, said sorry, and kept going.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: We were about to cross the intersection but noticed that an approaching vehicle was travelling fast and did not seem ready to stop . Had we decided to enter the crosswalk, we would have been hit. But we decided to not enter the intersection until the surprised driver saw us and came to a full stop.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: She turned left from the opposite side onto Shelbourne. I went over her hood as she hit me with the front left side of her car.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Heading East in the Laurier Avenue bike lane. Car turning right onto O'Connor didn't look and completely cut me off.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Fall
details: Lost control while turning onto Mont-Royal from St-Laurent. Hit a pothole which resulted in a cracked helmet and a concussion.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Heading East on Bay Street. Bike lane ended near Cedar Hill Road but there was still space for me to travel between parked cars and backed up traffic. One car stopped to let a car turn left in front of them and the car did not see me passing the stopped vehicle and they turned left in front of me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Heading towards the intersection at Bay street when a bright green taxi passed me so close I wobbled and almost fell off my bike. I'm used to riding in traffic, but he came VERY close and I wobbled and almost fell. I had to stop for a few minutes as I was pretty shaken up.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Van passed within one foot of me even though I was "taking the lane" and riding in the center. He also held his horn down for a long time. The lane is not wide enough to pass safely within the lane. Drivers must change lanes to pass in this area.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: This is a crazy intersection. The driver veered into my path right up against the curb and sandwiched me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle failed to stop at Stop Sign / behind Stop Line.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car ran a red light

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle slowed at stop sign but did not come to full stop. Began to accelerate while looking in other direction as I approached intersection. Skidded to a stop before we could collide but came very close.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Cycling home from work,  a truck stopped then started in the right hand turn from MacKenzie onto the highway.  I missed hitting the truck by millimeters.  The driver yelled "Sorry" as he drove off.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Cycling up Martindale turning right at the Welch Road.  Car on Welch road did not stop at the stop sign and went directly through the intersection.

Wife yelled and he swerved to avoid contact, I rode down into the field

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Distracted driver on cell phone

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: car didn't signal and pull over to park on the side of the road, I was riding there

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Terrible 5-road  intersection for cars not stopping and/or seeing cyclists or pedestrians. I have had several incidents in this intersection this past year mostly with drivers not stopping fully or looking. Some drivers unaware that musgrave is a through street here. Headed s toward willows is bad.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Person turning left crossed left over bike lane at top of hill. Side impact

i_type: Fall
details: https://www.fresnobee.com/news/local/crime/article253295223.html

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Right hook. Car turned right across path of person on bicycle in bike lane, with near collision. Driver unware of several people on bicycles in the bike lane. I have seen this same type of near miss many times at this intersection.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle was heading north on Moffatt to turn right onto Granville Ave. Vehicle slowed, did a quick check, and proceeded, crossing the bike lane directly in front of me. I skidded to avoid colliding with driver's side door. He was completely oblivious to my presence, even with my headlamp on strobe.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A very large truck was turning right in the center lane (there are 3 lanes per direction at this intersection, the bike lane is left of the turn right lane for vehicles). I was going straight and almost got hit.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Delivery truck driver opened his door and alighted truck in my cycling path without checking to see if it was safe to do so

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Near miss when a kid fell from a poorly maintained sidewalk/bike path, into the street

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Warehouse and business area. They don't expect to see cyclists around there and mainly look for cars when pulling out of parking lots

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Cyclist (me) was going straight ahead after doing complete stop at a 4-way stop intersection. Motorist came from the right, also going straight, slowed down but did not come to a stop and hit cyclist at a very slow speed.
N.B. exact date is approximate

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Riding close to the right edge of the path I came around a blind corner and encountered 4 bikes riding abreast. I was unable to stop and hit the cyclist closest to my side.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: cur turned right on Jay Ave(cut infant of me) as I was going straight on W 25th and I rode into the side of vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Stopped at 4 way intersection, had right of way. Driver to the left of me went at the same time as me, same within inches of hitting me in the intersection ( after I thought I made eye contact with her.)

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Hit by truck mirror.  Truck crossed line into oncoming lane at crosswalk whilst I was turning.  Driver sped off.   I reported accident Though driver not charged with leaving scene, demerits & large fine & damage to mirror.  Moral of story: file reports &follow up.

i_type: Fall
details: As I was braking for the stop sign ahead, my tires slipped on oil from recent asphalt repair and I landed on my side, with my head bouncing on the pavement. My brains seemed scrambled for a while. Thank goodness there was no car coming, or I would have been run over as well. My helmet cracked.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was going straight through on a green light, crossing Hemlock on 7th. A pick-up truck was going down the hill on Hemlock St at a high speed, ran the red, and swerved to avoid me. I stopped in my tracks, and was narrowly missed by inches.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Oncoming vehicle turned left into my path.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Riding up keith is hard enough let alone have cars speed by you at 60 k giving you may be 70 cm or room..A city dump truck almost hit me with total disregard for how wide his vehicle was

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was proceeding East through the traffic circle at Harris and Airport way when a car approaching from the South (going North) entered the traffic circle. I needed to veer left around the traffic circle to avoid collision. Car ended up less than 1 meter away on my right as they drove through.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Motorist turned into bike lane. Had to lock up both wheels, slide out and barely stop. They drove off....

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was in the roundabout and a vehicle entering the roundabout failed to yield

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was riding south on Shelbourne in the right hand lane. Driver passed me on my left and then turned  right to go west on Garnett . There was a pedestrian crossing Garnett (which I assume that the driver did not see in their haste to pass me) and the car had to suddenly stop  for the pedestrian.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car turning right, did not check, was in bike lane, driver stopped just short of hitting me as I continued straight.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

details: Stopped at red light on Bay (heading west). As light turned green a big SUV tried to pass me on the left (before I reached Cook street)  and hit me with their rear view mirror. Driver stopped and apologized.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Driver attempted to make a right hand turn onto Roosevelt going the wrong direction on a one way street.  

I was in left-hand lane about to turn onto 42nd.  

She did not see me because she was looking left, instead of right.  

Passenger noticed me and alerted the driver just in time

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Rammed off my bicycle intentionally by a police SUV on a bike path. Reason given was that I had run a red light, and that this was how he was going to teach me a lesson to bike safer.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: We moved from the traffic lane into the painted bike lane, adjacent to parked cars to let a taxi pass. As we did, someone in a parked car opened their door. My friend hit the door and went down. I went down over the top of her

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Access to underground car park, major hazards

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Road is narrowed there (its near the bus stop so the purpose is probably to slow down cars a bit - which unfortunately usually does not work).  Young driver of the Passat did not want to slow down and quite fast nearly hit me with his site mirror.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Riding through roundabout too fast, as car turned off main road

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

details: I observed a cyclist heading westbound along the Great Northern Way cycle path, crossing Glen. While she was just entering the intersection a car turning left from Great Northern Way onto Glen almost collided with her. She slammed on her brakes and skidded her bike to avoid the car.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A taxi was pulling a mid-block turn (like a 3 point U turn) in the midst of a bike lane, and 3 bikes (including myself) had to come to a stop as he pulled in and out, with no apparent awareness of the bikes.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car turned right onto Marigold cutting me off. Almost rammed into its side

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

details: Car travelling NW failed to slow or give way at roundabout and drove into the side of me as I crossed the roundabout

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

details: F-250 pickup truck side view mirror struck me on my back. Truck was traveling 65 kph. I was wearing a backpack and helmet. Both of which gave me some protection. I was thrown over the handlebars & sustained cuts & bruises only.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle went through stop sign heading south on Alberta St.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Travelling east down 9th avenue. Passing through a green light at Alma and Broadway.  Car facing west turned south as I passed through the intersection striking me with the front of the car against the side of my bike knocking me to the ground.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Pickup truck "buzzed" me in the bike lane. It passed very close with 2 wheels in the bike line, and moved fully into the bike lane immediately in front of me, then moved back into the car lane before the curve. Driver was either distracted or malicious.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

details: In a left turning lane to a side street.  Car turned right off of the side street and overturned coming close to entering into the turning lane I was in.  It was more a scare than anything

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle turned in front of me heading into the Camosun College parking lot.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle  turned left across lane and forced cyclist off paved roadway onto grass boulevard resulting in loss of control and collision with telephone pole.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was in the bike lane and bus pulled up beside me and started to pull into me to get to the bus stop.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Bike lane on Homer Street moving North is a painted line lane with cars parked on the right. Incident involved near collision with a vehicle that was pulling out of parking without signalling or looking behind at traffic on bike lane. I managed to skid to a stop just in time.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car turning right on red light wasn't looking forward. I was stationary waiting to cross on my green light and he drove into me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: very close call with deer running out onto the road right in front of our group of 14+ cyclists

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: right hook near miss

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car turning left (southbound) from McKenzie onto Blenkinsop cut me off.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver was pointed NW on the road.  I was going straight through the intersection, they were turning right.  They did not see me coming up beside them in the bike lane and thus proceeded to turn right when I was beside them.  I struck the rear passenger door as they turned.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle turning right without looking into bike lane - near miss.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was going straight and a car coming on the right almost hit me in the roundabout. The car didn't stop or slow down. Since I was going slowly I avoided the car by jumping in the middle of the roundabout.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: When crossing the intersection a car coming the other way tried to turn on her left (my right) and hit me. The driver didn't see me because there was another car in front of me that was going the same way.

i_type: Fall
details: Making right turn with right of way. Vehicle traveling other direction ran red light to make a left turn, cutting in front of me. Had to slam on brakes to avoid collision and went down. No cuts or scrapes, just heavy bruising.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Car door opened right in front of me with busy traffic. There was no room to get out of the way so I slammed on my braked and stopped inside the opened door.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: a car approached the intersection very rapidly and we almost collide. he could not see me but until very last minute because there were cars parked very closed to the intersection but the car was moving really fast so he had to slam on breaks.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car almost rear-ended me in the Keith Road uphill curb lane. There was very little traffic. The driver swerved around me into the second lane at the last moment. It was sunny and I wore a hi viz jacket.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: An SUV veered into the bike lane in the S curve at Lost Lagoon and almost hit me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was taking the lane around the blind corner when a fuel tractor trailer truck passed me in the northbound lane. As the truck passed me a vehicle came around the corner in the northbound direction and the tractor trailer truck had to veer back into the lane I was occupying cutting me off.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: I was taking the lane passing parked vehicles when a vehicle approached from behind and intentionally passed me with only inches to spare. I had a conversation with the driver and he didn't like that I was taking the lane.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle failed to yield to me in the traffic circle and knocked me down.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A car turned right infront of me which i avoided but then a car turned left and hit me.

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: A length of electrical tape was set-up to catch a cyclist. Rider could not see the tape because it was dark, and the tape blended in with the shadows thrown by overhead power and phone lines. Rider suffered series facial and spinal damage. Rider still commutes by bike.

i_type: Fall
details: Riding on the gravel connector between the end of the bike path and Esquimalt road beside the railroad tracks. Slipped on loose gravel and broke a leg.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Riding my bike on shoulder of Anderton Rd when a car stopped to turn left onto Dryden Rd.  A small dark blue pickup came up behind  and not wanting to wait for the driver to make the left turn passed  on the shoulder hitting me from behind, throwing me into the ditch,  Truck did not stop to help me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: ignorant driver at a stop at this silly 5-way intersection drove in front of me, having seen me, then waved.  Many incidents here.  Bad intersection.  Many drivers either do not stop to cross Musgrave or don't look or don't know that musgave is a through street.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Riders heading away from the downtown tend to bypass the little traffic island/pedestrian stop at fairly high speed. If your slow or not using the same "shortcut" you stand a high risk of being hit. After several near misses, I finally got nailed - OUCH!

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Truck trying to beat slow traffic tried to scoot up side of road and almost hit me. I was hit by a car back in May on the same road same type of incident.. broke my collar bone lots of bruises and scrapes..bike helmet was toast

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Aggressive driver, tail-gating the car ahead, blew by me and turned right in front of me onto 39th.  I was moving straight ahead on the designated bike route Willow to 37th to Heather.  Encountered same driver again on 37th  parking their car.  Was verbally harassed and threatened with assault.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was biking along the road where parked cars might be. Someone backed out of his driveway onto the road. Without slowing down, he continued to back up towards me in the parking lane. I jumped off my bike and jumped towards traffic, dragging my bike with me. Broad daylight, no rain. He never saw me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Several cars were in turning lane (my light) - one in front made it through before I entered the intersection. The one behind began the turn before waiting for the previous car fully cleared his field of vision, nearly hit me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car slowed down for a stop sign, but failed to come to a complete stop and drifted through the intersection.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: This type of incident has happened on 3 occasions.  There is heavy traffic as parent safe dropping off students.  Cars parking on the side of road and cars turning into student drop off area.  I have been cut off once and pushed into the cars parked on side and had doors open in in my lane.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Similar to other incidents ignorant cabbie saw me coming on  musgrave and pulled out in front I swerved to pass he followed me down musgrave. Terrible intersection. Come on oak bay... Keep up with saanich and Victoria with bike infrastructure!  These 1940s intersections are begging for tragedy.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
I was riding S on Cook when the driver came out of Park. Her SUV clipped my rear bike wheel and I fell on my hip. The driver stopped, apologized, and drove me home.

IMO the driver's view was obscured by  a parked car on Cook, and she drove past the designated stop line to be able to see.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Riding on the Hornby St. bike lane heading North, coming from Pacific Blvd, & crossing intersection at Drake St.
Dedicated cyclist & vehicle traffic light were green. 
Two vehicles turned right onto Drake St from Hornby St.without shoulder checking and nearly missed 5 cyclists on bike lane.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle approached quickly from behind, forcing me to shift position to the right to avoid.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Turning left, two vehicles were ahead of the stop sign on Richardon. I slowed to let the first vehicle travel through the intersection, the taxi behind started to roll as I started to turn. He stopped but I was forced to stop quickly. My yelling at him brought attention of a police officer nearby

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was almost hit by a car overtaking to get to the light before it changed. He didn't make it. Passed me very close!

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Truck turning right cut into the bike lane without shoulder checking and cut me off.  I was forced to brake quickly and move hard to the right.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Me on my bike, helmet on, service truck ahead of me. Service truck turns right as he signals into the parking lot of the marina. I collide with the front right tire of the truck, flying over the truck, landing on my right shoulder, breaking my collar bone.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Persistent gravel spot in intersection. Lost traction. Ate pavement (low-sided), resluting in much blood from head requiring stitches and smashed my helmet. Road rash on inner lip, ground up knuckles and broken brake lever.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Riding straight through intersection. East and west bound traffic had a red light a SUV came to a rolling stop and then continued to turn right on the red light which is where they hit my back wheel. I fell from my bike.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The road is too narrow to share the lane with cars, so I started riding in the centre of the lane for that section. The driver of black sedan 156 SRA honked from behind and beside me, swore/shouted, and swerved in front of me. Then shouted and swore at me when we were both stopped at the light.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: Frequent vehicles parked in the separated bike line picking up/dropping off passengers for the Canada Line station. This happens every day and all the time. Hardly any room to bike between the vehicles and gain access to the physically separated bike lane. Car door and pedestrian hazards.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I saw a cyclist get hit by a car crossing the sidewalk at Gabriola & MacKenzie. The car stopped and the cyclist was helped by first aid and 911 was called.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
A vehicle heading westbound turned left illegally from 10th. I swerved to avoid collision and fell, resulting in a partial dislocation of my shoulder and some general scrapes and bruises.
The driver drove away while I was picking myself up and walking out of the intersection.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Another cyclist emerged from an alley and crossed in front of me, without looking, slowing or checking for checking for traffic.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A large truck trailer had just passed through the intersection. I went through after the truck and a car going the opposite direction (towards the ambulance building) didn't stop and hit me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver of a silver sedan blew through the stop sign at Ardersier Road and the Galloping Goose. I could see that she wasn't likely to stop, so I slammed on my breaks. There were many cyclists in the area at the time.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle turned right  off Trans Canada onto Harriet Rd and collision happened in crosswalk.  this intersection needs a significant safety upgrade!

i_type: Collision with stationary object or vehicle
Collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: The westbound bike lane on Esquimalt ends as it approaches Tyee. At that point the travel lane is marked with sharrows seemingly to allow cyclists continuing west on Esquimalt to get into the bike lane. Motorists coming up behind and turning right onto Tyee often ignore this and pass unsafely.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car was waiting at a stop sign (seemed to be using their phone) for over 30 seconds as I rode up (with right of way). Right as I approached the intersection they all of a sudden decided to go through the intersection without first looking and I had to slam on my brakes to not hit it.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Not me, observed other cyclist.
Cyclist crossed McKenzie at East crossing (to continue on Lochside trail) on Green light, and was almost clipped by a Right turning green Cab. Armwaving\flipping-off the other party was done from both sides

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Turning left (N) at intersection of Fort and Foul Bay. Driver heading West on Fort ran late yellow while I was in the lane and had to take evasive action to avoid hitting me.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicle turned left off of Burdett heading north on Vancouver, forcing me to dodge right to avoid them.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: At a four way stop. I was the second vehicle and stopped to wait for the cross traffic vehicle on to the right. When the 1st car had passed through the intersection I began to proceed through the intersection when a second car coming from the right again, failed to stop at the stop sign.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
there is construction at the intersection.  the big huge milk truck and tank was further left than usual, not in the typical turning lane.  because of this I think his awareness of me and my awareness of him was lessened.

I was able to really slow down when I realized what was happening.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was traveling south on Borden crossing McKenzie turning right onto  sidewalk entrance to the bike path.  Other cyclist was northbound on bike path turning right onto the same sidewalk portion.   Sightline obscured by traffic. Tried to avoid collision but we hit at approximately 10kph each.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Overtaking car merged right toward me causing a near miss.

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle
details: A passenger in a car stop at some traffic lights opened their door into the unmarked bike lane. I hit the brakes and narrowly avoided a collision.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Going through intersection -- no light for Adanac street, but walk signal was flashing. I thought I had made eye contact with truck driver who was turning left and that he had seen me but I guess not. He turned left into my path but saw me at the last minute and jammed his brakes.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
In the half block before the stop sign to get onto king Ed, I (with my kids in the bike trailer) got cut off and nearly wedged between the back of the van and the parked car. 

If I was a car he would not have tried to go around me.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Rear ended by car while stopped at stop light.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Vehicles travelling North/South on 8th St regularly roll through stop signs, failing to yield to cyclists who are exiting the pathway and continuing on 3rd Ave (bicycles have right of way).

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Pedestrian stepped out from a group of people into roadway crosswalk on red light perpendicular to me at the exact moment I was riding through the intersection on a green light, approx. 1 meter from sidewalk. i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

I was behind my husband & started screaming & then the van driver stopped immediately.

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Crossing Street Using Bike Crossing
Taxi was waiting for light to turn green, proceeds when green.
I was caught in middle of intersection with quick light change.
Takes 5-6 seconds to cross main street on bike.
Light changes from Green to Red in 3 seconds.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Three cars turning right  on Davie St at the green light were oblivious to cyclists on the Hornby St bike lane and kept following each other without stopping or yielding and turning right without shoulder checking for cyclists on the bike lane.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Southbound vehicle turning right on red didn't see me approaching on the bike path eastbound. This is my commute and it happens on a regular basis. A no-right-on-red sign was installed recently, but it seems no one has noticed.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
The bike path crosses tuskawilla road (4 lanes w/ median) and offers a stop light.

Even after the light has turned red for all lanes and bikes have OK to cross light, drivers are not paying attention and blow through the red light.

This day I was inches from my front tire being hit by a car going at least 30mph.  The car did not stop.

Please be careful, most cars will stop and even then others will blow straight through.

i_type: Fall

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Car overtook me and immediately turned left, cutting me up.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

I calmly said "leash please" and the owner responded "calm down." A cyclist going the other way said "He's right, it is extremely dangerous."

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Fall
details:
Bridge crossing has grated surface on mixed use pathway. It was raining lightly and the grates become like grease. Very slippery and I slid out almost into the heavy traffic on the arrow bridge. Badly scraped my hip and legs even though I was wearing rain pants.
I ride over this bridge every day.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: A truck almost failed to yield the right of way at the crossing of the slip lane. I was travelling southbound on the path and the truck was using the right turn slip lane to get on the freeway/bridge, but didn't stop until we almost collided. Problem is motorists are focused on crossing motor traffic from their left, not peds or cyclists coming from the right. Also, there is a lack of clear ROW signage. Yield signs should be placed BEFORE the crossing, and the crossing should be a raised table.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

details: Minivan crossed painted bike lane from the left to access the right turn lane without shoulder checking, almost hitting me in the process. I had to slam on the brakes and even then just nearly missed getting clipped by their back bumper. Many cars cross the painted bike lane here, dangerous spot!

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
I was heading straight on Heron towards Fisher when a person in their vehicle, merging onto Heron from Prince of Wales drive did not look properly and almost hit the back, right side of my bike.  
I've witness near misses at this intersection before.  The merge off Prince of wales onto Heron is BAD

i_type: Collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Going south on Bank St in the bike lane along the Billings Bridge shopping center. A car left the parking and did not yield. I could not stop and hit the rear of the car hard enough that my chain fell off. Driver stopped and apologized.

Reported date is unreliable.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details:
Traveling South on the bike lane on Bank street along the Billings Bridge shopping center. A pickup truck traveling North on Bank street turned left 1-2m in front of me at high speed to get to the shopping center and almost hit me. The driver threatened me when I confronted.

Date approximate

i_type: Fall
details: Most cars turn left here (as do I). This time, a car ahead wanted to turn right at the intersection. He gunned it, in spite of pedestrians, but then he hit the brakes. So did I, to avoid a collision. New disc brakes downhill meant I went over. He never stopped. Fractured ribs and dislocated thumb.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Oncoming car in the intersection almost turned left in front of me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
Collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Heading east on Robertson Road in bike lane, going approx. 20km /hr., car exiting fast food restaurant collided with me. Low speed impact & he braked too late failed to yield fine . Broken toe right foot, contusion's  , whiplash when thrown from bike. Physiotherapy for neck and shoulders 3 months.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: I was riding in the middle of the left lane because the right lane disappears due to construction in the underpass.   A driver who presumably had moved into the right lane to try to pass me on the right, veered back into the left lane where I was riding while his car was directly next to me. I stomped the pedals and swerved around the front corner of his car to avoid collision. He made eye contact with me while moving into the lane and didn't seem worried about nearly hitting me.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
details: Driver moved into my lane (right) from the left lane, cutting me off, then abruptly hit the brakes once in front of me.  I had to move far too the right to get out of the way and then had to hit my brakes with no notice.

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with stationary object or vehicle

i_type: Near collision with moving object or vehicle
